lovely, poignant, and at times distressing, journal is perhaps most interesting because of the way it reacts to your decisions. sometimes it feels as though the game, or the protagonist herself, is fighting against you. the tension created between what you want the protagonist to do and what she actually does, often in spite of the choices you make as the player, neatly underscores her own internal conflicts and the feelings of helplessness no doubt experienced by anyone going through a lot of rough stuff at home. it seems that you remain a troubled youngster no matter what you do.

i read about it very briefly, that it was meant to be a relaxing and engaging experience, and it being super cheap decided to try it. well, i should have watched videos of gameplay prior i suppose, as -the music isn't particularly soothing. yes, i know, subjective and the vast majority of people love it but it isn't hammock or artesia when it comes to helping you wind down. -the 'story piece by piece' was a series of perhaps five images didn't make it past that that i could not decipher and were as engaging as lint. -gameplay is puzzle solving, in essence problem solving. this is most of what i do at work and as it didn't appear attached to any particular feeling of escapism in my case it was like coming home to go to work.

a pick up and play game, lead and gold has some good points going for it very skill-based, team-supportive, and a decent variety of maps and graphics. it's a fun game, when it's not utterly chaotic. you can spawn on top of a flag that teammates carry around the map, which is both an interesting mechanic, and very frustrating, when enemies pop up in your face with a shotgun in the middle of you focusing on something else. explosions, one-hit kills, and anyone able to pop up anywhere there are no choke points in any map can make for a very random, hectic, and skill-less battle at times. but if you can put up with it's unforgiving, crazy nature, it's rewarding. unfortunately there are just a lot of games that do this style way better. the most unique thing it has going for it is the wild west. out of

tl dr a fun sci-fi rpg, with a dark souls amp batman mixed combat style. an interesting crafting system, tons of skills, abilities and talents to mess around with builds, a pretty good companion system and top notch graphics. audio is pretty good, voice acting is a bit dodgy but acceptable for the studio size. overall it's an enjoyable game to wittle away a few hours on, would rate it something like . out of and recommend you give it a go if you like, souls games, rpgs or sci-fi games. for a quick overview of the game mechanics and gameplay you can check out my swift spotlight video here. youtube video swift spotlight - the technomancer nbsp

fun game, awesone serries. wrecked by lag. if you do not have a high performance computer, don't buy this game. you will not enjoy the jerking camera, the non responsive units, delayed commands, mission critical units doing as they please, units destroied not by stupidity or cunning, but buy lag. in short, my comp runs at an average of . x better than the reccomended specs and the game now runs like . the updates have made things worse, and support tickets have not resoved any issues when they have been finnally answered. the problem persists across a number of people i play with and should you purchase the game be aware that single player and lan are the only options - internet multiplayer doesn't work consistantly and people drop from games if it takes too long to load sync place first unit - and i should mention they dont have a choice the game does it for you, even if you were first to load with highest performance on the whole, go back to the origional men of war.

probably the most challenging and most rewarding video game i have ever played. a true simulation of real life. you start out as bobley, you wake up in the middle of no where, and have no ing idea where you are. this doesn't matter to bobley, there is construction to be done. you get up and hop across buildings and cranes. you drive trucks and forklifts to their doom. you drive a nitrous fuled dump truck and shoot your load everywhere. the whole time you have no idea what the is going on but you slowly grow to realise that this is always going to get harder, and will never end. this is what hell looks like. theres work to be done bobley, get to it.

there is nothing i would change about this game. it is an experience unlike any other and a true marriage of story and gameplay. if you're interested in a game that uses its control scheme as a way to connect with the characters and show you how they work together, look no further than brothers. i'll make just one reservation. this game is designed to be played with a controller. there is an option to use the keyboard, but i do not recommend it because the manner in which a controller functions plays an essential role in the conclusion of this masterpiece.

gonna be honest, came to this without any kind of kickstarter bias and i can really say i got my money worth. i was looking forward to multi planet systems to fight over and maybe a few space battles. theres sorta that? the typical system i've run into in galactic conquest is about - planets max. each planet feels way too small. remeber taht episode of rick and morty with the tiny planet at the end of season two? imagine trying to go to war on that. i make no jokes when i say there are command and conquer maps bigger then these planets. also its not all that fun as the ai kinda sucks. and honestly i'd be mad if i had paid more then five bucks for it. in all seriousness its games like this that make me only buy games on deep deep discount sales. go buy dawn of war or something for a rewarding single player rts experience, this is only really a good buy if you super love the concept and find it for really cheap.

alright, so when you read this you're going to immediately think 'ok, this guy is trolling or exaggerating or just being silly.' i assure you, that is not the case. i'm sincere. dark souls is the very worst game i have ever played. the pc controls keyboard mouse are so horribly, painfully broken.. the game is unplayable. not only that, but the game does not allow players to configure a controller. it's a double-jeopardy situation. literally seconds into the game, there was an on-screen instruction telling me to press the red b-button on my xbox controller. i don't own an xbox. i don't own an xbox controller. i own a pc. why is my pc game telling me to press an xbox controller button? clearly something is very broken and very wrong. i'm calling my credit card company to contest the charge on my purchase. this game is literally unplayable.

what a hidden gem of a game! original story, excellent gameplay, and it require the use of your brain. i couldn't stop playing. true to the rpg genre, there is more than one track the character can take. seperate skills allow for some customization to individual tastes. for a game from a small, obviously underfunded studio in germany, this is exceptional. there are some bugs, and the dialogue is a bit cheesy, but it doesn't detract from the experience. having played the english version, i don't know what may have been lost in translation. on the upside, the developers have an open relationship with users. they are working on possible patches for the technical issues and take player input seriously. ultimately, love this game! out of for sure. i look forward to the next masterpiece from deck . great job guys, keep it up!

this game is incredible, it's the most fun shooter to come out in a while. the guns and strategems all feel fun and different, and it's great trying out different builds and working well within a team or just being a jack of all trades. the feeling of anxiety and dread you get playing a tough level is something that's hard to produce in most games, and when the hits the fan it gets even better. the dangerous nature of the team, between friendly-fire and constant drop pods is definitely a great aspect, as well as often being hilarious. plus nothing makes you feel cooler than holding out for the drop ship, back to back surviving waves, or dropping right into the thick of the enemy crushing three of them with your drop pod and gunning down the rest, turning the tide of the fight for your squad. literally my only complaint is that they didn't sell a -pack for , so that i could give copies to my friends.

i purchased this game based on the graphics shown within the trailer. it looked like it held potential to be a wonderfully beautiful game. upon playing, this was by far one of the worst games i've played. i'll admit, i'm not a huge gamer but the graphics are extremely glitchy, the controls function poorly, i do not like how i cannot easily exit from the game, and there is no explanation upon start to even clue you in on what controls you need for basic use of the game. i had a decently confusing time figuring out the first platform simply because as someone that does not frequently play many different games, i was unsure of what the controls were. then there are spots that you can fall into deep 'holes' and there is simply no way to jump out. this is not a game i would recommend at all. even if it is cheap, i would say, don't waste your money on it and spend your money elsewhere.

don't be fooled by that co-op tag, this game is not co-op in any enjoyable way. unless you enjoy watching your friend do complicated, drawn-out puzzles for minutes then do not play this game with others. there is no split-screen or way to view your character while your friend plays theirs, you can only view one at a time. during certain parts of the game it forces you to play a single character for an entire level, leaving any friends you might be playing with to sit and be forced to watch you try and figure it out for the entire duration. the levels are also unnecessarily big for what they need to be, leaving you to run around up and down ladders and ropes just to extend the play time. this game might be enjoyable by yourself if you like running climbing simulators, but i didn't find anything enjoyable about it at all. i'm glad i bought it on sale and it's definitely not worth the standard price.

a well executed rpg which will blow you away. this is only a short game, however the storyline is so well written, it feels like you've been playing for weeks. the game has a beautiful mood complimented on all levels with a fantastic art style. there are many ways to make this game a lot harder while playing, giving appeasements to varied deities make the game a real challenge. however the average player will not find this a huge challenge. the varied weapons in the game keep enough interest in the fighting, however it might get a bit hack-n-slash toward the middle. the best part of this game is probably the narrator who explains the situations and sums up the mood for the entire game. far from getting annoying though, he adds epic. the music in this game is so beautiful and well-written it is only outdone by the artwork. so good in fact that i am downloading the soundtrack. dark, bright, colourful, grey, somber, funny. this is perfectly balanced and i cant recommend it enough!!

simple and rewarding, especially when your risky combination of virtual pet action-rpg for the vena oasis turns out to be a out of masterpiece and saves your company from bankruptcy. the background story that ties into game dev tycoon gives a faux history of the gaming industry, which is amusing but also allows you to interact with it as you choose which systems and markets to capitalize on. the lack of research points i often experienced was annoying though, and i wish you earned more so you could train your employees more often. the good simple but can be challenging making good games is rewarding allusions in 'story' to gaming industry are fun the bad - never enough research points - out of out of review scores if you're a fan of management style games or have ever thought about making your own games, you'll probably like this. it's tons of fun and great for short intervals or long periods of time.

chains is a great puzzle game about chaining together large links of colored balls. there are different levels, with different difficulty levels. very fun for . usd. variety is not an issue in chains, you will find yourself using your mouse as quickly as possible, other times you will be trying to find the best way to get a certain color as indiginant to the level as possible. the sound track is well done, but is repeated constantly if you have been on a level for some time. the art style is great and doesn't hurt my eyes. but occasionally, there are some framerate stutters that ruin the flow of the game. p.s. do not go into full screen mode, the screen goes black and flickers and you can't do anything while that happens. pros fun, challenging, strategic, variety, cheap cons framerate stutter, fullscreen mode, soundtrack repeat overall . out of

i'll preface this review by saying that i'm an insatiable fan of the horror, thriller, and suspense genres of video games and movies. the first three times i played, i didn't survive through the first night. the fourth time i played, i lived until am on the second night, then that lovely bear got a hold of me. the score music is intense. graphics are ok. gamplay is basic. overall, the game is unnerving, and i'll continue to play, as each time i pee a little, and hopefully one day beat the game.

napoleon total war is a very interesting strategy game where you control a nation during the napoleonic wars. the game is focused on battles, but you can still control your nation's diplomacy, technology, and much more. it is a very fun and engaging game, and i find myself becoming immersed whenever i play it.

the binding of issac is one of those games that keeps you playing, you die a bunch as is a rogue type game. but the fact that everything is randomized makes every time you play unique. it's easy enough to understand the mechanics, just shoot and move, but as enemies appear there's always something to be surprised by.

i bought this game because it looked like an alright platformer and it was on sale. but this game is charming and fun. though i haven't gotten to the tougher parts yet, the simple level design and even simpler story elements add a very tight and streamlined feel to this game. the writtings on the wall are hilarious and present a really fresh twist on effective story telling i have not seen in a while maybe since the ratman in portal .

i heard a lot of hate going into this game, but its plain and simple, some classic total war. i really enjoy the challenge of dealing with all these evil roaming hordes. it makes fighting on different fronts much more challenging. you never know where attila and his horde will show up and raze your cities to the ground. especially if you're taking cities that don't belong to your faction. you could invest so much into a city and then watch it all burn. it really makes you feel the loss and revenge threfore is so much sweeter. if you like previous total war games, its great. if you've never tried total war before, its as good a place to start as any other. fantastic rts.

if i had to describe the main aspects of the game in one sentence it would probably sound like this climb, collect and fight sometimes. this doesn't sound too exciting, but.. i really enjoyed this game. it's not as story driven as the sands of time games, but this doesn't mean that there is no story at all. in fact this game has a beautiful way of providing the player with background lore, as long as you let the two protagonists talk to each other once in a while. the world is beautifully designed and offers more and bigger open areas than the sands of time trilogy, although they are quite linear. smaller indoor sections like rooms in a castle or a dungeon are relatively rare in this game. the combat system isn't as dynamic as in sands of time and while fighting bosses extremely quick-time-event based. however, this is not a major letdown, since the main gameplay consists of exploring and acrobatically climbing through the world. at last something, which is very important to me. this game does not require u-play.

normally an awesome game, but it doesnt seem to be working on my lap top. ive tried a variety of tips to fix it but all i can do is get to the main menu before the game crashes. i have oficially wasted ten dollars on a great game that i cannot play, thanks steam for selling it to me. so i highly reccomend not buying this game becasue it seems like many people have the same problem i ran into.

amazing story and voice-over. combat might be a bit tricky for those not used to tactical pause-and-play rpg strategy gaming. you need to pause quite a bit and move your characters away from red-colored damage areas if you don't want your party to get 'wiped'. have i said that the story and voice-over was amazing yet? because yes, it really was. in some scenes i was literally in tears. i was like 'wth?!' why are cartoony pictures and voice-over acting dialogue affecting me so much?! so yeah.. the script was that good.

anyone with a facebook page should play this. great commentary on the age of the internet where privacy may very well be just an illusion we feed ourselves. it's also an interesting twist on the idea of a power fantasy. you don't have big guns or magic powers, you have personal information of everyone at your finger tips. and information is power no? be prepared tho for a somewhat guided experience. to keep the story in line, there are only chosen lines of text that you can pick out, but you still have the power to pick whether or not you include some of them. main issue i have with this otherwise smart game is that it's a little difficult to keep track find data you chose to not pick out because you previously thought it wasn't relevant. and it's kinda hard to tell what data will move the story forward vs what is data that you can leave out to change the outcome.

the online multiplayer is far from perfect. but it functions. as i progress through arcade mode i just leave the fight finder on. usually doesnt give me time to get one ultimate combo finish in before i am being challenged. im sitting around wins in online fights. so its doing something right for me. going for the achievements is fun. gives you a goal. though i will never get them all and i know this, i am sad that i was seduced inro spending more dollars on this game to upgrade it to ultimate. i could see the achievements for ultimate when my game was actually running ssfivae. so i paid for characters, a couple stages, the ability to get more achievements, and the ability to choose my ultimate combo preference. also i think the online multiplayer got harder after i updated to usfiv. suddenly i was being challanged by higher grade opponents, even with the finder set to 'same skill'. but in the end i keep turning this game on and enjoying it lately. its a fighter. turn it on, play out your luck, turn it off before it gets frustrating.

ah, the good life. as you may see from this video, it looks wonderful. first, i need steam trading cards for this game. they're like sunken treasure. but anyway.. imagine a world where you take enormous amounts of money from people to transport them between tropical islands in an archepelago, flogging them food and drugs along the way. well, here it is. you are completely in charge, to the point where if you want to abandon ship halfway through transporting them to go diving for treasure, you can. you probably shouldn't, but you can. it's the sort of nonsense i love. and it is, nonsense. if you are looking for an in-depth business or management sim, this is not it. this is for relaxing with in a moment of downtime. and it would be relaxing, if it weren't for the tornados, pirates, and screaming drowning people. but let's not talk about them. it's too harrowing.

this game was so much fun with a great combat system with silly ragdoll-decapitation physics. but then.. patch after patch, 'fixes' that broke more the game even more. crap optimization. nerfing classes instead of improving the bubble system among other things. messing with hitboxes, increasing decreasing stamina usage that give certain classes a real disadvantage. desyncing attack animations that are just beyond the worst. ever since that crap gb update toward late last year to early this year, this game hasn't been very fun. for me, it was the patches that ruined the game. almost every death will leave you asking 'uhhhhm ok? how did i not block that?' or something along those lines.

best total war series game available. my favorite aspect is how they made each race so unique in terms of units, abilities, playstyle, and economy. i love the implementation of the warhammer art design and lore into the game. hours in and not a single bug, crash, glitch, etc. running a ti, gb ram, i k, win . as for negatives, the game could use a few more races, more details obstacles on some of the battlefields, and it probably won't keep my interest more than - weeks similar to most strategy games .

a short game well worth the original price. your objective is to kill groups of enemies in the bloodiest and fastest way possible, and you'll have an assortment of weapons to help you achieve this goal. you can just run through the game, but carelessness doesn't net you high marks and often results in death. a little effort into planning goes a long way and can make this a very enjoyable game. aside from game play, the story, the music, and the graphics immerse you in its own quirky little world. the developers made something really interesting here. beating the game and meeting certain achievements unlocks new masks which unlock new abilities, so replay can give old levels a reason to play through again. just seeing this game on sale made me want to write this review in case my friends were considering buying this game. this game is worth buying.

the engine is literally not changed in the slightest from the original game, which is basically grounds enough for a thumbs down since the engine was in serious need of fixing before. aside from that. the levels are generally better this time around, more action and less tedious waiting games. the boss is also way way better than anything in the original and actually fun and all that, so props on that. i can't say it's that bad level-design wise though there's still some stupid things like no spare hits in stage and lots of moments where you're expected to predict the future especially in regards to what path to go . the difficulty is pretty even throughout, about the same as the third world of the original game. if i were judging based on the level design alone i probably would recommend this but because the developers saw fit to push out a new game before fixing the previous problems i can't recommend it on policy.

don't even know what to think about this game. of course it comes from the same people who made warz and they use the same models and still have a horrible problem with scaling objects. ffs the bar is head level, the door of the suv is larger than the character, and the military medkit is the size of a small child it really seems like whoever is developing this game just said it when they put the models into the world. on the other hand it isn't nearly as shaddy as warz with microtransactions where they sell ammo and it just so happens that ammo is hard to find. you will not have the same problem finding ammo and guns in this game, which is a welcome change to their formula. the game is average overall and it is shame that their previous work will mean this game will never get a real shot at being popular. not mad i bought it but i am not particularlly happy either. judging by their player count and steam ranking i doubt this game has any longevity or developer support. good try sergey titov and weird hat guy, good try.

after having opened packs and only getting rares with legendaries, along with dungeoneering runs with all being a rating over out of , and having found that anyone using rares legendaries holds a much, much higher advantage-- gt such as, the usefullness gap from uncommon to rare, and rare to legendary is just way to big. i've come to the conclusion that, while the games idea is incredible, its overall requirement to invest either days of your life, or nearly triple digits in usd, this game is hardly worth playing in comparison to hearthstone, which, i've noticed epics and legendaries come from packs much more often, packs are cheaper if you go for them in either real currency or in game currency, and has less of a gap from common gt rare gt epic gt legendary in card usefulness. this game is clearly a micro-transaction oriented game and just tries to reel you in with its unique gameplay. overall, a out of . stick to hearthstone and save your time dollars.

roleplay? checked. pirate duties? checked. strategic team battles? checked. good community? checked. pushes your mind to the limit? checked. competitiveness? checked. this game has everything you want in a role-playing game. you can customise your character, own pets, get a house and furnish it. join a crew and play your way up the ranks or start your own crew if you're confident enough. there is also a very good community. i'd recommend playing in the doubloon servers. doubloons are the 'premium' currency in the game however don't let it deter you from playing. you can trade the in-game currency poe or pieces of eight for players who are selling it. go check it out! it'll be worth your time.

the concepts for a solid game are all here, but this is very cheaply made, unpolished, and poorly balanced. controls and physics are extremely sensitive, leading to you spending most of the game overcorrecting the ball's movement. i had to adjust the mouse sensitivity on a per-level basis. the mouse cursor leaves the game boundary when trying to whip the camera around too quickly. it's easy to accidentally click the mouse and restart the level. everything has really basic textures, simplistic music, and stock sound effects. the game minimizes when you click away from it, which is pain when trying to stream it. this game is playable in the most technical sense of the word. it could've been a fun experience with more time and attention. you might enjoy it if you're looking to beat an obnoxiously challenging game out of spite. if so, good luck!

homeworld s gameplay was ditched in favor of homeworld s. units are still singular, but they behave and attack like the ones in the second game.. that means even in defensive mode, my units were wandering far away from the mothership. the formations also don't work, putting units in the sphere mode and then setting them to guard something doesn't make them form the sphere around the thing they're guarding, nor split up when defending several individual units. the scout and interceptor weapon projectiles are not a hail of bullets, now its a steady but noticably slower stream of bolts. fuel is totally gone. salvage units can capture fighters now because it does a premade animation rather than fly at the target until its close enough, furthermore it lost the graphic on its capture nodes. these are only a few of the irritating changes, it's just not fun this way. i wouldn't recommend playing this legally.

simply put, one of the most immediately addicting games i have ever played gorgeous and cleverly designed tables galore. if you don't like pinball, you probably won't enjoy this title. it does innovate, but it doesn't change what it is at it's core. endless replayable hi-score fun. original tables from the dev's with rich themes and additions that wouldn't be possible on a real table. graphics and sounds are what you would expect. leaderboards and stats galore. -from what i can tell, no real life tables. those seem to be the focus of the other pinball game on steam, pinball arcade. unfortunately, that game charges an insanely high amount for their table recreations - but that's exactly what they are, recreations of real tables, which is what pinball fx lacks. my main gripe is that some tables made by zen for pinball fx are a little broken, whereas the tables in pinball arcade are based on real life tables which seem to be balanced better overall. the tables in pinball fx are sold at a very fair price.

i actually didn't mind this game, but downvoting to balance out the score a bit. strata is one of these games that is 'ok' - easy to be content with, but difficult to love. the premise of the game is to select 'ribbons' in a certain order to fill out a grid with the correct colours. the design is minimalistic and rather soothing. the game is actually pretty fun at first, but has serious scaling issues. the problem is that every puzzle has the same solution - i don't mean that the ribbon combination is the same, but the thought process to solve each puzzle is identical. once you pin down the logic to solve a x grid, you just do the same thing with a x or x . with puzzle games i like to occasionally feel that i am very close to solving a problem, or that i am just missing a small piece to complete it successfully - strata will never give you that feeling, that's why it is only mediocre to me. out of

to the moon is a story driven game built on the rpg maker engine. as a result, its graphics are charming yet simple, and there is little to no gameplay to be found. it is akin to a visual novel, but does not pertain to the same structure. to the moon has an astoundingly good story. you play as two doctors who implant memories into dying patients, granting their final wish to become a reality in their heads. its an interesting concept, and presents itself to unique situations. the story goes backwards in time, with the two doctors reaching deeper into his memory to eventually change it. the story of the patient, john, is heart warming and excellently told. the soundtrack is excellent as well - the piano pieces convey so much emotion, and all of it ties together to give the game an excellent feeling. i cannot recommend this enough. what it lacks in gameplay is made up for with its excellent story, and i look forward to future releases.

obsidian's underrated espionage rpg, alpha protocol has amazing malleability and replayability as far as how you shape the story with your mission choices and the way you treat others. the open nature of choosing your missions can cause you to meet allies who will help you in later missions.. or remember what you did to them the next time you meet, so be cautious you may even miss a couple of characters entirely depending on where your travels take you! the game also has an incredible dialog system, where people will come to know you by your actions and expect you to act a certain way - you can prove them right, or throw them off - something that can come to your advantage played carefully. enemy or ally, both can work to your favor. also interesting is the ability to choose a background that further affects conversations and gives your extra points in different categories. choose rookie first! while the gameplay is your standard tps rpg hybrid, this game is a must have for anyone that enjoys games with top tier dialog and freedom of character development such as vampire the masquerade bloodlines or fallout new vegas.

interesting concept but very poorly executed. i get that some games prioritize telling a story over having enjoyable gameplay, but cibele basically has none. the gameplay itself is just incredibly boring, and doesn't offer the player any substance. all it consists of is playing a fictional game where you click on enemies, and nothing more. it is excruciatingly boring. this game should have just been created in the form of a short video. the story itself is told via voice-overs and files on the player's computer. at first i thought the story would be somewhat interesting, but it is told in a terribly cringey way, which made it impossible to relate to the player character. having the main character say 'i always do my best to look anime ', and yes that is a literal quote, is the easiest way i've ever seen to drive people away from a game. not only is the method of storytelling executed quite poorly, but the story in itself is nothing to write home about. i found myself completely unable to care for the relationship between this nina and her internet boyfriend.

i'll get the bad out of the way first. in some ways the remaster still lacks polish, some messy scenes, the controls are still weird and clunky, and the entire plot will probably give you a headache at first consideration. some of the ui is messy and confusing after jumping from menu screen to menu screen. all this said the silver case lives up to being a classic suda game in every respect. the writing once you wrap your mind around it is brilliant. it jumps from ham fisted to ethereal and mysterious. the translation while kind of tacky sometimes captures in this the sort of translation you'd expect in making the whole game feel like a dive into a time capsule. the silver case is a heady postmodern masterwork that has all the quirks and loveable motifs from any grasshopper manufacture game. it is a rare slice of history kept true to source in an era where games preservation is fighting uphill. if you like off kilter visual novels or adventure games this is worth the trip.

well that was a fun ride. for those who enjoy turn-based rpg, then this is the game for you. this game comes complete with - hilarious characters - awesome skills, spells, and summons - tons of equipments for a variety of combinations to use in battle - awesome soundtrack by hfx - new game for even more replay value i've been keeping track of the ebf series since the second game. and i still haven't beaten them on epic and it makes me happy as a fan to see how each new game improves compared to the previous game. this game was made by an awesome guy who has been making awesome free games. buying this game would help out a ton for matt for all his hard work. even if you can't buy it, then you can play the free version on kongregate, along with every other games he has made. the experience is still the same, no matter what version of ebf you play.

nothing but a big mod for civilization v. lacks new innovation, sluggish and boring gameplay. makes you appreciate the original civ games much more. pros - alien ai's present a better challenge than barbarians had - basics for the game are easy to learn if you've played the other civ games - quests present a fun way to extend benefits for your basic buildings and tiles cons - ai civs have no personality and quotes are exactly the same as civ v - no innovation in new gameplay, techs, buildings, and units - units can only be upgraded after you've reached a certain level, and only one class at a time, making your units stale for long periods of time - health happiness is very hard to gain, there are no luxuries but about more resources for building - aliens are the biggest threat, it's hard to explore water or land without dying in on hit - tech system is horrible, that's all there is to it

shadowverse is a excellent and addicting rpg card game. the card character artwork and animation is amazing. the music soundtack is also excellent. the battle backgrounds are nice i just wish there was more of a variety. the netcode is also very solid and i'm actually able to play online matches in shadowverse unlike other popular card games out there. overall, a very solid collectible card game.

ok, let's be a bit structured pros - good point'n'click humour in the spirit of a 'classic' game simon the sorcerer monkey island - the story is enjoyable, and so are the characters - it is pretty long for a point'n'click getting all the dialogue options and finishing the game took me about hours - many references to pop culture, especially medfan universes - it isn't as simplistic easy obvious as a telltale point'n'click.. in my opinion ! - the voice acting is cool! cons - graphics are not that good, even though the fact did not affect my gaming experience - some parts of the game, especially at the beginning, are a bit easy - the end of the plot felt a bit rushed to me. in a nutshell if you feel nostalgic about good ol'lucasarts point'n'clicks, this game may be for you! i'm personally a big fan of monkey island sam and max hit the road,.. and i found the game very enjoyable.

my, my..this game has been on the top of my most wanted list for quite some time now and i gotta say..it is truly amazing. pros -beautiful and detailed visuals -world seems so 'alive' -fascinating narrator and protagonist -real-time and turn-based combat style is a good mix-up -games doesn't make you go through the same thing over and over again, it mixes things up -intriguing story. -music is sooo good -dialogue is so strategically placed -pretty cheap in fact, having a whooping retail price of -indie and by the same developers of bastion, what's not to love? cons -some visuals during combat are 'not as good' off to conclusion, this game is good, no its a true masterpiece. i can understand why it has won so many awards, the dialogue, the music, the setting and the characters all of these help it shape the world of 'transistor'. i'm not here to spoil any part of the story since my aim is to you the person reading my review. to personally pick up a copy and try it out, its worth the money final verdict pick it up! score . out of now, supergiant make another masterpiece game already, please

i downloaded this game last friday cause me and my dad used to play it when i was little. let me tell you, it has gone way down hill. now, i do not cuss very often, nor do i ever use racial slurs. and i have been banned from about of my favorite servers already. why? cause friendly fire is on, and people will jump in front of you, and you team kill, and then you get banned. or, your on the mic, and say, 'oh my god', and get kicked for using religious slurs. and no, it doesn't depend on the server. cause one of my favorite servers, nicknamed the 'blitzreig wh res', banned me for team killing in a close quarters hallway with a support class. i got banned from my most favorite server because i don't know. this guy literally said, 'that's not tolerated' and banned me. this game used to be so fun, and everyone just had a blast. now its an uptight, strict, clan run, admin abusing embarrassment. don't waste your ten dollars. unless you want the wwii expirience so bad your willing to sacrafice your own fun.

tldr avoid it. fans of the franchise, wait for it to go on sale for under . it's story isn't any better or worse than what we've read in other extended universe alien media. my play through was fun only because i did co-op with a friend and the situations we got ourselves into were often times funny. fans of aliens will want to stop and look around to see things from the movie and listen to the audio logs. it seems like an immense amount of effort went into making hadley's hope movie accurate. and impressively enough, it certainly was. at the cost of neglecting everything else about the game. the game is dated in just about every way. and you really notice it immediately and often. also, hicks is in this game. and the explanation for why he isn't dead is rather silly. there doesn't even seem to be a significant reason for him to be alive other than as fan service.

it's kinda nauseating at first the way the character reaches for things, the lunge in and out over stuff, you don't really notice it at first but then it hits you and its like ugh i feel sick, eventually i kinda moved past it and it was ok again, but i didn't really like that mechanic of the game. i don't know how far into the game i am, i got to a mental hospital and got crazy and i was like this was not in the preview, what is happening how did i end up in a horror game. so..that was misleading.. i kinda haven't gone back to it yet, because i was noping all over the place. i'm kinda mixed on if i want to recommend this game or not. i'm kinda out of thinking about it. it was pretty cool, until it threw in ghosts and nightmare creatures. if you like horror, and thieving, then you might like this, if you're a wimp and moving behind you freaks you out..thennnn maybe not this game.

firstly, this game is perfectly acceptable in some ways. i like pve shootery stuff. i like the fantasy feels with the modern military theme. works fine. making people unable to play medics or engineers out of the gate is dumb. you know what? classes should be playable. no one is allowed to get rezzed because no one has medic unlocked is just a bad plan. the mouse's aim speed literally changes at random at all times. i cannot hit anything because it decides it's going to go way faster or way slower basically at the drop of a hat. this game has hard-locked, memory-dump-and-bluescreened my win . machine twice in only an hour's playtime. i uninstalled this already. the technical problems are too great seriously, randomly changing mouse sensitivity? , and with crytek employees not going to work and not getting paid, i have no confidence that this will get out of beta.

its not terrible. the game itself is fun, but it is kind of a waste in a way also. given the size of the map and extremely small amount of visible players allowed, it feels pretty much dead. it claims it is a living game, but in reality it isn't. there is nothing innovative about this game. basically it is a prettied up version of nfsw with less visible players and a better map. it is always online, so if they decide to shut down servers, you won't even be able to play it. other players in the game seem to keep to themselves, have yet to find a pvp match or co-op in time played and i queue for it fairly often. i bought this game on sale and still feel kind of ripped off. i'd give it a thumbs up if it was in the under section, but its not.

gameplay first person exploration. find necessary tools to advance in certain areas. search for clues and mementoes. take pictures. use walkie-talkie a lot . i like how it doesn't have a lot of hud and messages on the screen, it lets you be more in-game. plot nothing special, but the the way it is presented is nice. even suspenseful at times. graphics cartoonish graphics tf -like or close to the witness is bringing the cuteness to the game. you barely see another human being, but the nature is always there. nice lighting, shadows and textures. gotta love those sunsets don't forget to take a picture! . music not always there, but turns on in suitable moments. overall very nice game. the voice actors did a great job. it is short hours of not really fast-paced gameplay , but gives you something to think about in the process. the ending is fine by me. see it for yourself.

i adore this game. i was unfortunately pretty awful at the bullet-hell style battles so i finished off watching the game from other people's let's-plays on youtube. the story pulled me in from the beginning and the light-hearted humour which overshadows such a dark and tragic story is cleverly done. i found myself both laughing and crying uncontrollably at certain points of the game. my favourite aspect of this game is the soundtrack. every song on the ost stands out in one way or another and i find myself listening to them when doing seemingly normal tasks day to day. i recommend this game to anyone who loves story driven games. this game is a gem and i hope this isn't the last we see of the story. out of , love it love it love it!!

a really fantastic game that reminds me a lot of battle of britian on my old commodore many years ago. i have to say though with modern computing and gaming in general this a really whole new world. the ai is crafty and can wipe you out if you can't keep up. interesting tactical map situations put you into real binds. do i need a radar? or do i place a aa gun and try to soften the german bombing groups en route and then strike? oh and there is that little thing about lacking planes. maybe i need to build a factory. it reall is quite a puzzler. also the battle map is super simplified yet very satisfying as you try your best to cause the maximum damage in a situation where you are ussually outnumbered, without losing pilots and machines. a great game that will have you suffering from missing time syndrome. if you tell yourself, okay minutes then off to the movies, you may find that minutes multiplying into hours. good stuff!

i'll be completing the game soon. by far, it's a great game with a fantastic atmosphere. it sets in an eerie tone even outside of the asylum. though, i can't agree with those who say it's the scariest game. there's a few jump scares but it's nothing disturbing. any chases or parts where you have to sneak past monsters and such are not scary, but merely stressful because as much as i mash my left click button, my character won't hide in the damn locker. i find the scariest games are the ones that disturb the most. you know, the ones that send shivers or make your stomach turn. that's not in this game unless you're squeamish. the pools of blood and stacks of dead bodies get rather boring after a while. i started off in this game by slowly opening doors and expecting anything to jump at me but now i'm running down the halls just trying to complete the objectives. the scare really faded from it ten minutes in. it's still a fantastic game.

how do you feel about sticks? well, i was ambivelent about them before playing this game, and now i find them annoying. lifeless planet mixes up the whole, walk, jump thing with random sticks that shoot out of the ground and kill you. some that will kill you are an obvious 'danger' red, while the safe ones are brown, but every now and then the brown ones will kill you too. and just to mix it up occasionally there will be no sticks around until one suddenly spings out of the ground to kill you. i assume these are clipping issues, but it's annoying and not fun.

a slow walk down a short road. an excruciatingly slow plod through sixteen rooms that you'll have to walk through long after overstaying their welcome. i would not call this an adventure game, as those commonly have story and puzzles to go with the walking from screen to screen. in fact, i hesitate to call this a game at all because while there is a beginning and end, what occurs in the middle is a series of short animation cycles that happen around you. other than walking to the edges of the screen, the only meaningful action you can take is to open your map or advance time to the next day or night. it's really more of a short animated feature that you have to click on to move forward.

weird game. you can describe the game in many ways, you can describe it as funny, ridiculous, missing objectives, full of objectives, bugged, full of mods and even traumatic. but i would describe it as weird. you can be an ninja indiana jones that builds things, fill them with skyrim guards and then explode it. you can be a portal robot while you kill aliens that shoots nyan cats. you can go multiplayer and be a terrorist traitor that suicides himself with kamikaze bombs, you can disguise yourself as a melon and play hide 'n seek. it is an funny game. a hilarious game. but a really, really, really weird game.

pros - good graphics - well optimized - good sniper ballistics the game excels at those things but that's it. cons - terrible botched story. - clunky and incredibly slow movement i should upload videos of it really . - game punishes you for doing what it's fun using the sniper rifle. - guy is a top operative sniper rifle but can't headshot a guy with a silenced pistol past feet. - best sniper in the game moisin is an expensive dlc obviously.. - poor hit-detection box shots that go through the clothes and not the body of enemies kill them . last but not least stupidly repetitive - singleplayer shoot with sniper, relocate, wait, shoot with sniper, relocate, wait, etc. - multiplayer get vantage point, wait until something moves, camp scoped the spot where player is hiding, wait until he moves and shoot. moisin dominates the mp scene. if you don't have it, you will lose a huge edge.

finally.. a role playing game where your moral choices aren't black or white, and nor necessarily result in the consequences you intended. instead, you learn to acknowledge that the world in which you inhabit is more or less out of your control. you do your best and then all you can do is pray to your lord and maker that he somehow forgives you in the end. .. just like real life. this is a watershed moment in role-playing and story telling in games.

magic duels origins basically does the same mistakes as duel of the planeswalkers it simplifies a game that lives of its complexity. first for the pro - the game is free to play and such easily accesible for new players - the tutorial is well made and most of the campaign is well balanced to introduce beginners to the game - all the cards can be optained just by playing - the game looks kind of nice and the deckbuilding-wizard is a great help to get started now the cons - the game simplifies many aspects of mtg, losing charm for advanced players - the campaign is partially really unbalanced which can be really frustrating - the cardpool is very limited at the moment and it takes ages to afford new boosters - quests can only be completed with wizarded decks - the controls are unintuitive conclusion duels origins is a good way for absolute beginners to get into magic, but it lacks way too many features and gameplay aspects to even be remotely interesting for advanced players. but since its free you can still have your fun with the game, playing some wanky cards you'd never play anywhere else.

don't look at the metascore for this one. this is an old-school shooter with tight controls, satisfying gameplay, and a fantastic-looking environment. it's also full of crude humor and general oldschool machoness. think serious sam or duke nukem, but with a lot more melee options. the gameplay is tight, you move fast, the enemies strafe and dodge your fire. the environments are detailed and feel realistic as opposed to seriouis sam, where alleys look like football stadiums . the game is linear, but there are plenty of hidden gems and secrets to be found. it's also full of references to old school shooters. this game is gorgeous, even on low settings. but if you want higher fidelity you'd have to add a bit of heat to your graphics cards. sometimes the enemies feel a bit repetitive or even bullet-spongey. the characters are maybe a bit too macho to be likeable, the same way that bulletstorm's characters didn't really appeal to me.

this game is mediocre at best and lacks feature that made the nd in the franchise pretty fun to play. i think if they would of added a shadow of mordor general type of system with mob bosses and luitenants it would of been much better. to sum it up, mafia iii is like playing an outdated mafia sequel with better eye candy. cons very repetitive, for example missions, animations, and music that makes the game feel more like a grind than enjoyable. weird lighting that makes lakes rivers glow like the sun when the sky is dark and cloudy. arcade feel all around. classic mafia gameplay that has less features than mafia ii. pros decent graphics. voice acting and facial animations are very good. colectable bewbies. the stealth system. the story so far is predictable but, still enjoyable.

note steam hasn't properly tracked the number of hours i've played. i have far more than what it says this is the best stealth game i've ever played. i love the powers that help you move around and remain undetected. i usually don't try to do special 'runs' in video games, like 'no gun run' or 'no powers run' but the stealth in this game was so much fun that i took the time to do a 'no kills' run and it was fantastic. watching patrol routes, finding places to hide unconcious bodies, and executing the perfect strategy while having no one see you is immensely gratifying in this game. i also love the save function. i can save at any point and retry a section until i do it the way i meant to. i don't like having to replay an entire level just because i messed up on one decision late in a level. this game lets me restart from where i want to as long as i saved. i can't wait for the next game to come out.

i start playing and think 'cute'. then the language is off, to the point of making the instructions confusing. then i come to see this is a very simple resource allocation game where you order droids to counter an onslaught of enemy droids. then i think 'hmm..that sounds familiar.' this is almost exactly like that resource allocation game where you order plants to counter an onslaught of zomblies. the difference? the language in pvz isn't off and pvz is f p. i applaud whoever worked so hard on the art, but sorry, this is not terribly original and definitely not how i thought i'd be killed on something called death by gameshow. maybe the devs need to revisit the seminal works in the death-by-gameshow genre smashtv and the movie the running man.

so far, so good. plays like an awkward beat hazard clone. i like the stylized video, but there is something overall.. off.. about this game. the creators try to set up a story-- good on them. beat hazard doesn't really have one. but.. it makes no sense. and the gameplay itself is never explained. what does pew-pewing roughly hewn electronic faces have to do with defeating demons afterall? i'd like to seen some vastly different gameplay, even something pac-man like would have been better. t then there's just-- this.. awkward tone. like there's soft piano music between tracks, yet there's demons poorly hewn ones with overdone cliches abounding everywhere-- from the voice to the glowing eyes . and.. there's soft piano music with this throwback like-- visual boy on a neon graphic set. neons? classical music? symphony? demons? space ships? whut?

rating - . out of stars. it's super easy to just pick up and play. the user interface is well thought out. while appearing deceptively simple, this game actually has a lot of depth. it's endless, not really a sandbox, but it just keeps going on as long as you play. replayability. there are so many types of monster tennants you can have. the graphics are silky smooth d, and go great with the soundtracks that play. the game overall just looks great. the only con i could find is a few small annoyances related to text in the game, which could be polished up a little bit, but do the job well enough. in summary, i say if you have four bucks, get this game now.

it took me about seven minutes to play this game. i was a bit lost at first. fitting, really. i suppose a fly would feel lost too in such a vast universe. and insignificant. what's a fly in the great equation of the cosmos? after the initial uneasiness caused by the realisation of playing as an insect wore off, i started to ascend. because everyone needs a purpose - a plan. might as well try to see the world from a higher perspective. and that was when the boredom gave its place to curiosity, then to fear. and sympathy. the moment the fly got to relative safety i felt such a feeling of relief. as i kept asceding and the environment changed to something more symbolic, i realised that silent tears were running down my cheek. i was so immersed in the moment i didn't notice i was crying. when the final scene began to unfold, all i could think of was 'oh no, oh no, oh no..'. and then, silence. the shock and regret was too profound. do yourself a favour and try this. it's such a masterful piece of art for the price of nothing.

i completed this in minutes while i was bored. they tried to do a telltale thing, but because none of the characters are interesting and, again, you can complete it in half-an-hour it's a failure. i see this better as a demo to show off story-telling in games and how it could be harnessed, but that's clearly not what the creator s were going with as there's worth of dlc for this. i know what you're saying, 'the game is supposed to be replayed to get different endings, like the stanley parable', and that's a good point. however the stanley parable has a sense of interaction and the changes in there drastically change the story, unlike in this game where it doesn't really. i replayed the stanley parable because i knew that there were so many different options i could take that would create an entirely different ending, including an ending where you play a minigame for hours, but i did not replay this game. this would be better as a browser-based demo where the dlc was unlocked while playing the game.

as big a visual improvement half-life source is over the original, it's sadly riddled with bugs. on first play, i wasn't able to progress past the first chapter as the game script appeared to be broken when a security guard or scientist was supposed to open a door for me but wouldn't. there are also numerous sound and rendering issues, such as weapons being invisible and the sound of your gund being played in the distance. there's a particularly nasty bug on one of the levels where a storm drain is blocked by a grate that isn't meant to be there. the only way past was to use the noclip cheat. with the original half-life on steam for the same price, the graphics won't be as good but you won't get these game-destroying bugs. avoid.

metal slug defense is a casual, laid-back, tower defense game that consists of a base on both ends of the map. players can have a deck of up to units maximum to send out to advance towards the enemy base and then watch them battle to the death. but there's a catch, after a certain time limit has passed the player may use their 'metal slug attack' ability which sends out a flashing tank that charges across the map and mows through weak units and explodes on contact with heavy units. there are various factions in-game where if your deck consists of a single faction, you can get hp bonuses for the round. one may find the game to become extremely repetitive due to the lack of challenge, and this is coming from playing the ios version of the game where you won't have to deal with any pay--win scams. but unfortuntately, you will never see any of the above description since the game doesn't even launch. play on ios or android instead or try out their better title 'metal slug attack' pros uninstall button works just fine. cons bruh dont even get me started

is it elite? yep it's elite jazzed up with st century gfx, vr capable, and a good community built behind it. so if you enjoyed the original elite, or like the idea of space combat trading simulation with reasonable flight physics, then this is a good game. however .. as far as multi player goes, it's still in its infancy. the potential for griefers, or just outright exploit bullying, is there, making the solo mode far more preferable if you don't want to have to deal with smegheads. the lack of playable demo modes makes it hard to justify paying so much s cold - especially with the horizons espansion pack that's just been released, which means you have to fork over the same price you paid for the core game - and i'm not sure what it adds to justify that price tag because, no demo to check that out from . i remember the original elite, so there's a nostalgia value in the game for me right now but i don't know if that'll be enough to keep me interested enough to make this a regular game once the newness reminiscing wears off.

at first, everyone was making fun of sonic amp sega all-stars racing because it looked like a mario kart rip-off. now, because of the three vehicule types gameplay, people are comparing it to diddy kong racing. compare this game as much as you want, it's still one of the greatest arcade racing game of the past years and also one of the best kart racers of all time. with an all-star cast featuring characters from the sonic franchise, underground franchises like jet set radio and super monkey ball and characters from other games such as the crew from team fortress and general winter from company of heroes , this game is an absolute blast. the team behind this game is composed of many members from other developers who made games such as project gotham racing, blur and split second. it's an amazing game, packed with alot of tracks, missions, a career mode that is awesome and the replay value is sky high. an absolute must for anyone who likes racing, sonic or sega in general.

so it's sad but the main reason i bought this game is because it was pretty. and the scenery is really nice to look at.. i had to turn off the motion blur but with everything else on high it just looks so vivid and alive. but unfortunately graphics aren't the only thing you need in a game, and the gameplay in this is rather weak. it basically boils down to a handful of puzzles to solve, none of which are that difficult. and after you solve all the puzzles and beat the game there's really no replay value unless you want to take nice, quiet walks in the woods. so i just stumbled through the game in a little over hours, got all the 'side stories' and even though i had fun i really can't recommend the game at the current price tag of .. so.. hold off on this game until it's at least off or more. it's fun, and it's pretty, but it's just way too short for the price.

my 'friend' you may remember him from my ghost train vr review is at it again. he bought me this game tonight. you see, my 'friend' understands that i like a lot of idle incremental clicker type games. he figured 'this should be something he'll enjoy' as he gifted it to me. he was wrong. this is a bad game. it's obviously supposed to send you the message that sweatshops suck and it does it by having a very sucky experience of play. you playing this game feels like working at a sweatshop. the progression is entirely too slow not 'incremental' enough it requires entirely too much actual attention to make progress not 'idle' enough, too much 'clicker' and about the only entertaining aspect of it is the music, which was more likely than not public domain. so for a genre that's already at the bottom of the barrel in terms of entertaining, this game is the bottom of that barrel.

i know there's been a lot of controversy about the game though recent updates have made the experience a bit more silky smooth. i've seen performance increases with each update. this is basically the world's best planet exploring simulator, although it's disappointing that it didn't live up to early trailers or the hype. the quest for the atlas path is not to be undertaken unless you want a huge slab of emptying sadness with the final result - same goes for the centre of the universe, though i would recommend this game if you want to get out and explore a few new planets for a short amount of time. combat is adequate. alien encounters are a binary choice of hostile or non-hostle. inventory management is still a chore. i'm sure more improvements are in the works although it is a shame that the game could have been so much more.

a fun game when it works, but the game's ai is almost unforgivably bad. i understand this is meant to encourage multiplayer games between humans, but finding a fair and balanced game is just as difficult for a new player, and if a game is going to try to have a single-player version it needs to be more than the token effort this game has supplied. the number of times the ai opponent clearly anticipates the cards in your hand that it's not supposed to know you have, or will obviously work together against you in multi-ai opponent games, will leave you tearing out your hair in frustration. don't get me wrong, i enjoyed the game, and have fun playing it, but that's more from the simple enjoyment of m tg itself. purely objectively looking at this game, it is riddled with flaws that in most other franchises would instantly see it uninstalled and never played again. buy it if you're a fan, enjoy it while you can, but don't buy this expecting a classic that will change your life.

where to begin.. well the game is pretty fun and pretty addicting but multiplayer is a big bucket of smashed s. i think elsword is the only game where i was ever brutally spamed by a level player. this is where i said bull because if a level can defeat me as for me being level then there is somthing horrifically broken with the game. so i did a little research and relised these people that were utterly destroying me had wins and losses. now this is an impossible feat. and yet this type off bs goes unchecked. now if you play it by yourself its an ok game but pvp is broken. i never ever cheat in mmorpgs but appearently everyone else does in elsword. if you like pvp then dont try elsword.

dcs world is a very good simulation. it takes quite some time to get to know the su- t aircraft that comes for free with the game, but it's definitely worth it. personally, i recommend robert sogomonian's youtube tutorial series on the su- t to get you started. it's a great experience to take off, fly a route, destroy some targets and land safely all on your own. recommended!

i have had a lot of fun a lot of fun with planetary annihilation and getting titans made my expearience with the game a lot better. after hrs on the vanilla game its nice to get some new content. obviously the game has its bugs sometimes but the game is getting better every update and this addition is a welcome sight to pa in my eyes. the new units and maps really change up the game play and make new stratigic possibilities open. overall id give the update a out of . love the new content but and map designs but i really wish they would finish polishing the game but as it stands right now its still a solid game. i would recommend this to people with computers with decent power the game is bit hard to run on good setting unless you have a decent computer.

beef spooky's house of jumpscares is probably one of my favorite horror games. there's a ton of references to other horrorgames i'm someone who's easily spooked, and my friends have most certainly enjoyed hearing my screams in panic when the cutest little squid pops up in my screen. i have also enjoyed the screams of a bunch of my friends in the same way. i recommend anyone to make a friend play this while at their house or screensharing during a call. some of the enemies are actually more challenging than i had thought, and it took quite a while till i beat the final boss i must say i'm not really a pro gamer though and it's completely free

so i went into this game hopeful. the intro cutscene was a little lackluster with a thick dousing of fantasy garble. the first scene you play through you begin to notice the writing is a little forced and maybe not the games strong suit. continuing past a leap-frog styled tutorial you finnally get your hands on some combat, and its not much better. this continues for a few levels. and then it happens. you find youself infront of your first real boss which is actaully just a random mob by the name of something that started with a y and rolled around the keyboard for few strokes. you will know him as buffzilla the minute encounter. he cloaks himself so you can't attack him for three turns. all the while he is healing and shooting up buffs like a junky just out of the drunk tank. your party members will have have a few turns to kill him before he goes ghost again and heals back whatever little damage you could pour onto him cause bro accuracy is a . he is a standard mob encounter. commence the grinding or peace out. out of peace'd out

movement and ui is very clunky--completely designed for a controller that lacks the grace and fluidity of mouse keyboard. save points are few and counterintuitive--one would think that meditating or fast travelling would generate a save, but not always. i find i'm pressing and re-pressing 'quicksave' over and over again, not very immersive. story, length, and graphics get thumbs up. this is my first witcher, so i'm disappointed to find i have to use the same ugly gervalt throughout the story, but that's a small matter. combat is 'okay,' but not thrilling--and somewhat annoying because i'm always accidentally switching off the sign i want. combat suffers from the same ui clunkiness, hard to tell when i can move attack action and when i'm stunned or recovering or whatever. i feel i have little control over combat. all in all, rather disappointing.

a dark, beautifully written, downright entertaining work of art. the style is an obvious nod to the late, great h.r. giger, but with it's own unique feel. they've perfectly captured the dark and forboding biomechanical world that they were aiming for. the puzzles are tricky, but not too difficult.i found that i never got stuck on one puzzle for long, but i never seemed to breeze through them too quickly, either. perfect paciing, i would say. it is plainly obvious that the developers of this game put a tremendous amount of love into this game. they have got to be some of the most dedicated point amp click adventure fans in the world to have put together something this great. it's a modern work of art. i don't do that whole number rating thing because it's pretty arbitrary and pointless but i will say that if you are a fan of the point and click adventure genre, this game is an absolute must have, if you love surreal, biomechanical style artwork, this game is a must have. if you like a good, dark story, this game is a must have.

more of an expansion pack than a whole new game. really dislike the quests especially those at odds with popular opinion e.g. killing 'bugs' or carrying out espionage. the lack of diversity with military units poor but i do like the army wide improvements. the trade posts also frustrate as they invariably land where it is ideal to send a colonist unit. lack of intelligent aliens also weak, if no higher species availale a greater diversity of aliens would be good, flying ones for example. gone back to civ v, just completed a game and now there is an option to carry on 'beyond earth', click on it and it leads you to the new game, really reiforcing the feeling of an expansion rather than whole new game. so if i do start a new game all the tech i learnt is now redundant, my cultural etc. advantages are wiped etc. at least give me additional time to settle the new planet if i have beaten all the other nations into space.

firstly let me start by saying that i absolutely love the bioshock series. now, after playing this, it's really soured me on the series. this is a blatant cash in, because instead of working on a sequel or another entry in the series, k games have basically thrown the original games at a poor 'studio' to try and turn over some quick money. seriously don't bother. a very poor pc port once again, and in all honesty, other than a couple of ui improvements, there is nothing to distinguish this from the original. the worst part are the bugs. there are completely random ctd's, and other graphical glitches. pretty much every bug that existed in the original is present in this. you don't mind the bugs so much, but random ctd's that lose a couple of hours of gameplay? those aren't forgiveable.

alan wake is a very nice horror game adventure type game. i don't wanna get into details too much and ruin the story. you play as the famous author alan wake. he decides that he needs time away from being bothered by many of his rampant fans. him and his wife go to a small town called brightsprings where they plan to vacation at. throughout the game alan starts to notice things are going strange thoughout their trip. if you have a decent computer that can handle the beautiful graphics and you are looking for a horror adventure game i recommend you take a look at alan wake when it goes on sale. personally in my opinion after playing through the game, i rate it . out of because the game has a interesting story line along with beautiful graphics and combat, however the game does not attract me to play it over again for a long time.

a charming characterful shooter that ultimately feels lifeless and lackluster. weapons largely feel dull and unvaried, and lack of any discernable power progression turns combat into a slog. dungeons are large, but drops are sparse making exploration feel unrewarding. couple with gates requiring special keys that don't drop, and one gets the sense the game is resentful of being played. ui is stylized but hampering, to the point where it is quicker to alt-f and quickstart rather than sit through the slew of animations that play on character death.

wow, i had really forgotten how boring these kind of games were. all the tedious micro management and villagers standing idle a pixel away from their work and soldiers running for the wood for no apparent reason. maybe this was ok when one was young and had all the time in the world but now it all just felt like a waste of game time. sure, all games are a waste of time in some way but this was a boring waste of time. and that is the worst kind. graphics update was disappointing and texture mods only helped a little. still felt like playing an old game and not in a good way. glad i bought it on sale and only wasted a little money.

ace of spades was a great game..was. the classic ctf is still here and is one of the few good gamemodes in this game. the vip and territory control gamemodes are the only other good gamemodes, and not even they justify the purchase. any class-based gamemodes are a complete waste of time. the classes are extremely unbalanced and the marksman class is obviously the strongest. the game doesn't even seem to know what it wants to be. it shows elements of tf and cod cod negatives, that is and jagex, like everything they touch, ruined the game. there is a moderately entertaining zombie gamemode, but again, there isnt enough here to justify the purchase for any price. dont buy it! go to www.buildandshoot.com to play the classic ace of spades for free! do not waste your money!

this game is not overhyped trash, this game isn't something that should have 'never got the reconition it deserved'. this game is good, very good in fact but there is a glaring flaw that keeps them game from being an enjoyable experience to becoming a slam your head on the desk frustrating. this game does not have diffculty, this game has fake diffculty. too much rng to make this anymore involed than rolling a dice. almost everything is rng attacking, walking, scouting, drops, shops, etc. and when this goes together with a permadeath game, this doesn't make a good mixture. now i get it, this game is supposed to be hard but when i have no barring on whether or not the next run could completely end my best team for no reason on my part, i don't see a point in going on any farther.

tired of that pesky life? want to get away from exsistance? then why don't you come on down to anor londo where our gients will greet you and make you feel welcome. sit by the bonfire, test you archary skills or just lay down and relax while bathing in the totally real and not fake sun while of anor londo, while soaking in your own blood. wake up early and praise the sun with our trust worthy worker solaire. its jolly good co-operation! feel a bit too relaxed and want to get that blood pumping threw those vains? then just spend the day with our two personal trainers ornstein and smough. and of corse, all this can be done within private sessions or without others! what are you waiting for? get your self a ticket to the family resort of 'dark souls' anor londo city. it will only cost you you're soul.

your gatherer died of starvation your fisherman died of starvation your hunter died of starvation i'm not really sure what all the hype is about, maybe it got overhyped so i expected to much, but when half your town dies off because they all decide to move to the new house that doesn't receive food for some reason, or people freeze to death in their houses while the empty house next door has all the firewood they need, your logistics system is flawed in my view. it also doesn't make sense that those who gather the food tend to die first. some basic? simple? buttons to prevent people from moving to a new house would be welcome, or some sliders to limit the food firewood levels. i'm a bit surprised these aren't available. the game isn't bad, but given it's succes and time of release, i expected more polish.

warhammer k. a game with a rich history and historic battles. this game let's you be one of those marines that you command on the ground. i've heard about the series for years. but i've never had a chance to experience the ultramarines until now. i'd recommend this game to anyone who wants to simply destroy everything in your path in the most satisfying way possible. it's you against entire hoards. gotta love those odds. that's where you call upon the will of the emperor and tear the scourge to shreds in holy fury. this is a great start to get into the war hammer k series. i recommend it

max payne is, without a doubt, one of the absolute classics. ranging from bullet time to its brilliant graphic novel cutscenes, absolutely gripping, grim story and nice selection of weapons, this game has just about everything you might want in a game. despite its severly outdated graphics, it's still so much fun to play and really recommendable!

fez is clearly a love letter to old-school side-scrolling platformers like super mario and metroid. it's -bit aesthetics and sound are distinctive and charming, and the gameplay is incredibly therapeutic. playing fez isn't stressful at all, which is in line with creator phil fish's vision for a game that harkens back to children just playing and exploring without any clear objective. the rotation mechanic is a very creative addition to spice up the gameplay of traditional platformers. the ending is pretty remarkable in that it makes references to string theory and physics. awesome game!

while at first glance it might appear to get repetitive quickly, i found that payday was a really enjoyable experience. the missions never play out the same way twice and are all varied enough to keep the game feeling fresh. the rpg-like skill trees add a powerful sense of progression that truly make you feel as if you are specializing and getting more powerful. payday also features the most responsive and invigorating gunplay that i have experienced in any game. i would tirelessly recommend this game to any of my friends, especially if it is on sale.

this game is a pretty cool physics engine with almost limitless possibilities and permutations but i can't in good faith give this a thumbs up for reasons. everyone says the entire point of the game is that there is no goal or purpose and you can do whatever you want and use your imagination or whatever and that's all great except that there are literally no objectives. like it's fun sticking balloons on zombies and watching them fly away and setting up cool scenarios but it gets old. the absolute worst online community of any game i've ever played including call of duty and league. every single online mode you ever play has the most obnoxious year olds you can imagine who will sexually harass you if you're a woman or cuss at you in their prepubescent voice if you're anyone else.
