i was appealed by the theme and the beautiful graphics. while they're still absolutely stunning and gorgeous, i decided to stop playing this game. utterly disappointing. - very convoluted controls. it's really like playing a console game. one button does many things, convoluted menus, uncontrolled movements, very unnuanced. - complete lack of freedom. the game is extremely linear with no customization for your character, let alone the path you're taking. - very slow plodding along of the storyline. it bores you to death. - combat goes from ridiculously easy hacking away enemies without breaking a sweat to inexplicably difficult with four enemies beating the living daylights out of you without you even knowing what happened. extremely not recommended.

i know this is old-bone, but this game is nothing it's predecessors were. too arcady, made for the masses, no thinking involved, way too fast paced battles, you aren't able to enjoy the guys fighting it down there, as you were in previous games, way too much 'pro-micro' needed, trying to make it more competitive on the battlefield. annoying, and building an empire is not at all rewarding, with all the 'new' fixes and patches, is just became less irritating, tho still no separate unit movements on the map, no family tree etc. yes, the game improved a lot on other terms, but i just find it repetitive and boring after turns, also, the of dlc factions are lame, ea stlye. and then attila ? come again ? great, now i can take over europe with horses. same engine, probably same base. not interested thanks. having the warhammer world in under their title should've made them do a proper warhammer total war game, but no. attila. have fun with it. if you want to play a good total war game, get napoleon or shogun , not to mention the previous games were awesome too medieval ii, rome .

this game is quite a lot of fun but i only play it when i'm just trying to relax. ok, ok, lets just cut to the chase. here are my pros and cons about the game. pros -nice graphics -the easy difficulty is easy -no microtransactions unlike the mobile version -repetitive popping sounds you can turn this off -nice co-op setup -you can buy special agents with monkey money to help you in battle -you can't buy your way to victory -double money makes this game way better this only takes around - hours -awesome music don't get this game if you hate repetitive music or you don't like turning the music off cons -random crashes happens to mac's or rarely pc's this only happend to me once on a pc -you either have to have your sound on or off you can't adjust the volume on music or sound -the bosses are either too easy or too hard. this game is awesome for and for anyone who likes the thrill of unlocking new things to help out friends or yourself, this game is a steal! bloons td rating out of

i think this is a must for any car driver to use and enjoy. it brings home the difficulties truck drivers face day to day and as a car driver you suddenly appreciate the job they do. it's much harder than driving a car! the camera views, gameplay and over experience is very realistic and the radio you can listen to whilst driving is actually very easy going. i suddenly want to be a truck driver! overall as sims go.. . out of excellent and highly recommended.

i can't even describe how awful this game is. just read the other reviews. find a youtube video of someone playing it. you'll have more fun than you will actually playing this horrible mess. i'd call this a walking simulator, but that would be giving it far too much credit. walking sims generally don't makes you walk across a featureless landscape for straight minutes with the only sounds being the second music loop poorly looped and the sound of your breathing also poorly looped . technically speaking, while in space, all you would hear is your own breathing inside your helmet. but it comes across as simply lazy design in this monstrocity. the entire time you're walking, you are constantly being assailed by 'meteors'. apparently when we land on the moon, ther astronauts have to be constantly dodging falling 'rocks'. i use quotation marks, because the boulders in question more resemble giant foam rubber movie props that bounce around when they 'impact' the surface. and by 'impact', i mean they bounce around. seriously one of the worst games i've ever played.

have you ever wanted to be a beta tester for a broken game without all the hassle of being paid for it? good news, magic duels origins is the game for you. it crashes to desktop on computers that destroy the requirements and loads fine on pos laptops that don't meet them. it disconnects you from the server for no reason and tells you that it won't save anything you do from that point on even the single player stuff . oh, and for no reason the music volume will jump to , so that you can blow out your eardrums while being terrified of a sudden loud noise without having to make stops. seriously. assassin's creed unity at least has the excuse of being a complicated world with different animations, textures, ai, and gameplay elements to load all at once not a good excuse but at least it can be seen as a reason for all the bugs . this is a card game. no excuse for why this was released in this state.

this game is quirky, and you'll get a couple of laughs potentially if you play it with friends. which is ultimately what my review continues to reference. however, the choices, ultimately, are not yours. when the writer wants you to make a certain decision, an options such like this might appear . will be ever be the same? . goodbye. . goodbye. choosing one, will still result in goodbye, but you'll watch your character delete the message. this is the illusion of choice, which is an illusion of gameplay. it simply leaves you 'going along the motions' which is the worst kind of gameplay experience you can have. it is free. if you want it to be worth it, play it with friends and mock the insufferable emily, whom is so awful anyway, you will not want anything more than to sabotage your relationship with her. not recommended, but if you feel compelled, play it with people.

i had to make up a whole new word just to describe this game, said word being 'gorious'. 'gore' and 'glorious' mashed together. because that is what it is. it's gorious. in all seriousness now, this is possibly one of the most fun, gory and action packed games i've ever had the pleasure of playing. there is a story but it's not the main focus. this game's main focus is one thing and one thing only shooting the everloving hell hehe out of everything that moves using a variety of immensely fun-to-use guns, and an amazingly fun-to-use chainsaw. the blood, the gore, the explosions, everything about this game works together to create something that cannot be described with any word other than awesome.

one of the most memorable games you will ever play. if you need a reason to buy it, despite overwhemingly positive reviews, just know that everything about this game is amazing. the artwork is beautiful, the music is beautiful, the storyline is..you guessed it, beautiful. the choice making system keeps you on the edge of your seat. it also makes the game feel realistic. in real life, you would only have a split second to make a choice, and this game does a good job of making you believe in it. of course, now the little mermaid is ruined for me. but that's another point entirely. basically, buy this game. i would tell you more if i could, but these lips are sealed.

i understand that this game is designed to be 'silly' and 'glitchy on purpose' but quite frankly the novely of 'haha im an goat i can lick things' runs out within the first few minutes of playing. it's advertised as 'a break for the seriousness of modern gaming', and it does that well- that is to say, it's so over the top and ridiculous that it's annoying and frustrating. the whole 'glitches a lot to be funny' feels like a gimic, and gets old before you even get to properly enjoy the game itself. for , it's a ripoff. don't waste your money on a novelty.

this game goes to show that advanced graphics and crazy set-peices are not required to make a fantastic gaming experience. using the most simplified graphics and interface you will see in a modern game, thomas was alone brilliantly tells a story about a computer ai who is looking for friends. it is a platform puzzler that tests your brain, but isn't so difficult it will melt your mind. the soundtrack and narration are absolutely wonderful. this game deserves to be played..so do it! on the yeti scale of brilliance. highly recommeded.

as someone that only invested time on the campaign, i can say it's passable. the shooting mechanics feel tight, but you'll get that on pretty much any other fps game out there. the story is alright, you have a despicable villain with a revenge plot and a hero determined to stop him for killing his father just like one of my japanese animes , but it's nothing that spectacular. the thing that really came off as good were the side missions inside the game, where you get to organize different squads and drones to fulfill different objectives. these side missions brought some fresh air to the campaign, which is just an a to b shooting gallery filled with the ocational confusing obstacle. the multiplayer, which i just played like minutes of, is alright. i don't see why anyone would buy this game now, but it's definitely better than ghosts. i give it a out of . you can find better shooters out there, the whole tactical side-ops thing you can achieve far better with other strategic military games, like x-com or arma iii.

how to play hitman - wait hours after launch, server connectivity issues no longer a problem after year old vloggers make their unboxing, tutorial, walkthrough, let's play, and review videos, then promply return to their medal of duty hardlines playing and never pick up this game again - run the benchmark, if your card can't run it smoothely at max settings, turn the settings to 'medium' lt -- important step sometimes people forget how pc gaming works especially if you're coming from a console - launch the game. - before starting the tutorial, go to the gameplay settings and turn off all the in-game help and assists. you don't need them, seriously. figuring stuff out on your own is kind of the point of the game. - now play the first episode of the best hitman game ever made. - cross your fingers that future episodes will be at least as good. there. it's not as hard as these other reviews make it seem. goodluck

with so many mobas out there. which one is the best? well i can't answer that question for you, but i can tell you how great this game is. first off, this game has a steep learning curve, so if you prefer mindless action games, then this isn't for you. once you get past the learning curve however, that's when things start to get really fun. dive in to this action packed game as you battle other people across lanes in a team based enviroment. there is literally next to no grinding in this game, everyone starts at level in each game, so the only real question is, how far are you willing to go to become the best? watch other people play with in the in-built game viewer, and study a libary of heroes as you progressively become better. don't worry about people calling you a noob when you first play, because they were also noobs once! just ignore them and enjoy the rest of the game.

thomas was alone is a really sweet little platformer with a surprisingly deep and interesting story. its a very short game and can be completed within a few hours, but is definitely worth playing for the experience. the game isnt hard, and there are no difficulty levels, upgragrades, weapons or moral decisions. the game is however visually pleasing with a great soundtrack and the entire story and all the characters are voiced by danny wallace also the voice of shaun in assassins creed, if anyone is wondering . the script for this is top quality and gives each of the little rectangles their own personality, which danny wallace does and excellent job of bringing to life with different intonations and pacing for each character. a really good, fun experience, in a relaxed sort of way. - out of

this is a great fighting game that is simply not well optimized for pc. high voltage has consistently failed to patch properly and communicate, often causing more headaches any time they actually change anything. what certaintly should be the definitive version is held back by a terrible port. the game itself is great, but it is simply more worth if you buy it on ps . i am ashamed of high voltage, netherrealm, and wb. i have enjoyed the game itself, but the hassles with the port have soured what should have been an amazing experience.

brilliant game that's irrepairably marred by a broken online system. you might think you're in the clear once you get through the slow and convoluted web of installtions and sign-in's you need to start the game up for the first time, but even after hours of gameplay there's the very real possiblity that dark souls will simply stop working. i need to make myself perfeclty clear here, i don't mean the 'crashed and then restarted' kind of stopped working, i mean the 'tried to start up one day and couldn't even get to the loading screen' kind of stopped working. even so much as saving your game requires you to be constantly connected to the poorly conceived 'games for windows live', a service that has been completely discontinued by virtue of its overwhelming iness, leaving you with a broken game that can only be fixed by accessing features locked behind microsoft's drm, and with the only official support resource that might be able to help you being completely disbanded. if you have any other means of playing this game, i can reccomend it strongly, it's a brilliant game, but for the love of god do not get it for pc.

this is probably one of the absolute best games to come out last year. if it wasn't for the witcher and konami being s, this game would absolutely take the throne. it has extreme amount of content to it and is otherwise very well crafted. the optimization is so good it makes me every time i see big boss in the chopper at fps. goddammit i can't run anything on even stable frames and this thing of beauty goes smooth as butter even in the most detailed situation. otherwise, it's quite that they cut the ending and a lot of missions, and a crap-ton of things that were planned but didn't make aboard. damn konami, man. if you're looking to buy it and you're new to the franchise, i'd recommend beating mgs first. it's not on pc but it will tell you most of the story that you need to know aside from peace walker and ground zeroes and it's anotherwise a one big feels trip. all i can say about this game is that it's pretty good.

when it comes to the rogue like genre my first experience was with the game binding of isaac which really put me off to the genre as a whole because of its unforgiving difficulty and lack of empowerment plus i simply was no good . so when i was given the chance to try risk of rain, i pretty much had negative preassumptions going into it but the moment i said to myself and to my friend who i was playing with 'one more run', that's when i realized that it's hooks sank in and i was captivated. faced with the looming threat of rising difficulty, i appreciate the need to balance one's time between farming and moving forward within the levels. really it's addictive aspect is that with each run you have the possibility of being a force of nature within the game from all the perks buffs one can receive and it's really satisfying to jump into horde and just have at it. the fact that there are different classes allows for varied gameplay and the background music was a joy to listen to. still hesistant about roguelikes? after playing some of this, your answer will be no.

wow! a real hidden gem! it looks like a old game with -bit style graphics, but it'a actually a really kewl idea that i hope gets a sequel! cause thats the only thing about this game the left feeling lacking - the length. it was kinda short. but other than that it had a great puzzle system. i would recomend ths game to everyone. however i would wait to catch it on sale. bucks seems kinda steep for such a short game.

i have put near hours in to this if that says any thing about it, a masterful game with strong game play and with a high skill cap, plenty of gear and levels to play war frame is best played with buddys, and id recommend dropping five or ten bucks on it and forgetting the free to play. you can earn any thing in the game by playing, events offer any thing from new guns to cosmetic items but buy plat will make getting started a lot more easy, the only draw back to warframe is the truly insane crafting times to build new frames a and clan gear, but that is vastly out matched by it's meany other achievements. at it's base warframe was made by people and scott who love ninjas and space and robots and zombies and pirates, and made the perfect combination hack and slash and shot and space magic with rouge-like elements and rpg to bring you warframe a game about having fun!

pretty much, assassin's creed in middle-earth. i originally bought this game for my ps , but it ran like . then i got a new computer and bought it for pc, and the first thing that got me was the graphics.. it's not the best looking game in the world, but it's pretty good looking, and it runs really smooth. i always play this game for a few hours ,then leave it, and then i play it again, over and over. what can i say.. do you like assassin's creed ? do you like tolkien ? then what are you waiting for ? buy it and go chop some uruk heads !

another brilliant game from blendo games. the art style is simple but attractive, and the core gameplay is great. i found it a bit portal-esque, in that some of the puzzles stopped me up for a little while, but it was never terribly frustrating and i always felt clever when i solved it. i also really liked the cyberpunk-in-the- s style of all the interfaces, and the little story interludes between missions were great. very atmospheric and evocative when they needed to be.

i think that this game is one of my favourite indie fps games out there. the game has a counter strike global offensive feeling to it with battle feild graphics. also, the limited hub, no hit-markers, freindly fire, and smooth graphics make the game seem realistic. the only thing baout the game that i don't like is how op the frickin bombs are. like jesus christ, if your atleast feet away from a c it will kill you. but, i love the game, i recommend this game to any one who likes games ike arma and counter strike, this is for you.

there is a lot of bad comments about transport fevers signal system which they compare to open ttd which i would like to clarify a bit. the complain is that a train always goes to the assigned platform and does not 'smart' pick a free platform. which is possible in ttd with proper use of ttd's signal system. the reason that this can not be done in transport fever is because transport fever leans highly to be a simulation game. the goods that should be pickup are on that platform. if the train comes in on another free platform than all the goods needs to be moved which would be really time consuming. it is pretty rare that happens in real life.

only on the first campaign, and haven't even gotten to try out co-op or horde mode, and i'm arleady in love with this game. not only are the sniping mechanics a must in shooters for me on point, but the graphics, the zombies, the weapons- they're all very well done. i like the dismemberment of zombies, beating skeletons down, the x-ray kill cam shots. i like how when i don't nail that head shot, a zombie might re-animate and come for me, and you gotta watch out for those crawlers. sure, it borrows things from previous horror games, but all the best ones, and honestly.. this is my favorite zombie shooter so far. cod, l d and rez evil be damned. i love this game, and if a game can prove worth it in less than hours of playing it, it deserves recomendation.

looks great. but looks can be deceiving. this game biggest strength, is also its biggest weakness its theme. fighting in a realistic post-apocalyptic version of the most iconic modern city in the world, new york well, manahtten more specifically , is breath-taking. kudos to the enviroment team, you guys did your job. but, unfortunately, that means that enemy variety really, really sucks. you fight the same guys over and over and over again. and worst of all, the content is bland and seriously lacking anything memorable. wait a year for all the dlc which is was pulled from the main game, by the way to come out and then it might be worth it. the division doesn't know what to do with itself at end-game. the game design is seriously lacking repetition, repetition, repetition and don't get me started on the 'pvp' area known as the dark zone. i've spent hours in it and have never even been accidently shot by another player. at least you tried ubisoft, but i've played and will be spending what little free time i have playing better games.

samurai, ninjas, the joys of watching horses slam into a wall of peasants holding pointed sticks which then in turn are slammed by a wall of gatling gun bullets.. the counter artillery barrage from your cannons falls short and lands on the enemy generals head, ensuring your place standing atop the piled dead in an instant as what's left of the enemy runs for dear life while your calvalry cut them down for experience. chaos is a wonderful thing in pc gaming, i applaud the limitless mass carnage regimental combat has to offer and the unequaled brutal eyecandy that has you so enthralled you don't even notice your tea has been poisoned with nightshade. treacherous demon wench geishas are not to be trusted.

this game is awesome. combat mechanics are handled very well, requiring some tactical discernment and gives battles meaning beyond a pretty animation like in the civilzation series - or you can just skip the battles to keep it short. the concept of ruling the galaxy by each star system feels like a novel concept maybe because i haven't played a ton of x . and when you have so many star systems it becomes too much to keep track of, you can just tell the computer ai governors to keep track of them for you. better yet, you can tell the governors what to focus on - monetary improvements? military? food? the game in short is awesome. i haven't played a lot, but over the summer i would spend long hours through the night and extending into the early morning playing this game. and while it has been a while since i've played it's not because i got bored some steam sales caught my attention - i'm sure somebody can sympathize . great game and a nice addition to any x collection.

still worth playing, even after all these years, even if you played oblivion and skyrim first. and that isn't nostalgia talking, because i literally did not get this until i'd become bored with skyrim. you'll want a few mods if you've got a decent system, and want graphical improvements, but it plays pretty well out of the box anyway. still has an active modding community, even though a few major websites have died in the past few years. not a perfect game by any means, but the most creative one bethesda ever made.

well where to start. at this stage the game is nigh on unplayable. the pathing for mobs are imposible, the connection freezes and combat stops, and elements become uninteractable. the ui is waaay to cluttered, and it is next to impossible to find where things are. the unlocking of the elements as you progress is a good thing, but there is next to no description or explanation about how to access these elements. basically, this game seems to still be in alpha stage, and at this stage has no right being released to the public. all the creatures within the tutorial stage have waay too much health for the damage that your character does, which with the afforementioned lack of actual explanation with the introduction to the game systems leaves you wondering what you are doing in the game.

if you're late to the undertale party like i was, you may only know of this game for some awkward moments, witty one-liners, or even a few memes. rest assured, they're all here, but there is much more below the surface. what truly set undertale apart for me was the overwhelming amount of love and care poured into it. don't let the graphic style fool you this game more than makes up for it with its memorable and relatable characters, incredibly catchy soundtrack, consistently unique battles, and an attention to detail that would make any fan of the mother series proud. on top of all this, the most engaging aspect of undertale is the fact that there are always multiple solutions to any problem or opponent you face. the decision is yours to make as a player, and you only have yourself to praise blame for the results of your actions. this game's unique take on the traditional expected rpg was wonderfully refreshing. my only piece of advice if you are considering this game for purchase is to avoid spoilers at all costs. undertale is a game that is best experienced for yourself!

astonishingly poor. as a fan of the series, and a loyal buyer i am mesmerised at the utter redundancy of the inefficiency of the tactics you play or the individual intructions you give to a player. now, for example, ignazio abate will be charging down the right wing. he will beat his man, get to the byline and you will be watching on thinking, 'great! cut it back for a tap in!!' however, ignazio will not cut it back as instructed individually by telling him 'shoot less often', 'cross more often' and 'cross from byline'. after this has happened throughout an entire season, and after you have seen other players do similar, if not identical, actions then you begin to wonder what is the point? and that is exactly where i am at presently. what is the point? your decisions cannot effect the game accurately. you are a prisoner to the match engines preferences, and if you do not play within the confines of its desires then you might as well play a -- and get smashed - each game.

an pleasantly artistic and atmospheric point-and-click puzzler. it's a little demanding at times, requiring you to really think outside the box, but the puzzles are nonetheless clever for it. the story is fun, and leaves you wanting more. the playtime is pretty short, but the low price makes up for this. all in all, if you're looking for a short, well-crafted, and story-rich puzzler that claims to have more coming, mirrored - chapter is for you.

having beaten the game, i feel i can say that evoland ii drags on far longer than it deserves. the game does not lack wit or character, but i feel as though it lacks reward. other than fan service and heavy-handed references, the gameplay felt like it existed simply for the sake of the story which i feel was rather convoluted . as a player, i laughed a lot and got frustrated more often. not to mention i felt it lost sight of what made evoland special in the first place the gimmick. as a favor to yourself, play the game halfway through and then delete it. the entire second act of evoland ii is rife with tedium and frustration it almost feels like the game is punishing me for wanting to see it through. the only reason i continued playing especially through the terribly designed side-scrolling bullet hell is because i felt invested. play it, enjoy its quirks, but don't expect a masterpiece.

so, here's my take on it overall, it's a fun game, for one run-through, if you need something to play in short bursts. there's a bit of frustration in the beginning until you start getting some upgrades under your belt, at which point you can start to survive more than thirty seconds in the castle. however the plot falls a little flat, which wouldn't be a concern if they had just left it out, because let's face it, you don't really need plot in a roguelike. but since they took the time to give us journals and clues and a cohesive storyline, why make it so pointless in the end? when the boss asks why you're attacking him, i don't actually have an answer. however the game expects a much higher uptake of skill than i necessarily experienced. i'm not a n b by any stretch, but apparently i'm not hardcore enough for this. as soon as i tried the new game , i saw that the enemies had gotten exponentially harder and equally unfun to deal with. so if you're looking for long-term play this is only fun if you like frustration.

this game is surprisingly good for how early in the beta it is. it's music needs more variation though, i have only heard one combat song, and i think two planet songs, with one ambiant song for on ships. the art is obviously done by a skilled pixel artist. the combat can get repetetive and annoying. exploration and construction i find are the most fun parts, i've even already planned out a whole civilization for when the save wipes end. content reaches quite far, advanced apex labs and avian skyships are some examples. any content that isn't ingame you can probably find on the site's mod section, and if it doesn't exist, the modding is so easy that you can basically rule it, only instead of porn, it's mods. i made a doge mod to see how really moddable it is. not a complex mod, but one nonetheless. edit steam badge

in the current state of things, tharsis is just not enjoyable. a high difficulty combined with a punitive rng system just makes the game way, way too hard to be enjoyed. often, your dice pool is incredibly low after your second turn and you end up with ridiculous situations where you just want to give up. for example, you must repair a module with a total of points. that wouldn't be so bad, but said module also has stasis on dices, void on s and injury on . so you constantly lose your best rolls, get stuck with unhelpful dices you can't re-roll and if you're very unlucky, you'll roll a bunch of s that will kill your crew mates. i don't want to imagine what hard mode is like, really. this isn't an isolated occurence, it keeps happening over and over when you reach turn . while the game is simple enough in term of mechanics and the visuals, as well as the cutscene help setting the tone, this game will need a lot of fine tuning before it can shine properly.

buggy as all hell. it refused to let me finish one mission as there was an enemy stuck in the sand and my troops would not fire on it. all saves from that level had the same bug so i tried going back and completing the previous level again first, this time the game refused to unlock the strike planes duing the mission and wouldn't progress for no apparent reason. the art direction is nice and the movable base element is a nice touch but the bugs ruined it for me.

this is a very fun game if you are into time management survival style games. i spent a couple days heavily addicted to this game as i built my settlement out past people while learning to maximize my health and happiness. at one point a tornado hit and i had a few instances where fire broke out and caught on a few buildings before i got it under control.. the only down-side, if you consider it to be, is that there is no real 'objective' aside from surviving. you aren't competing with any other settlements, nothing is going to attack you, etc. you basically secure the necessary food, fire wood, building supplies, and continue on until you either get burned out, your cpu won't support any more fire smoke coming from buildings, or you have literally nowhere else to build. anyway - i really enjoyed the game. out of

honestly one of the best games i've played this year. fun and addicting dungeon runner, with rpg elements. in the beginning you'll probably suck and die alot, but as you progress and upgrade skills you'll get stronger and stronger, and be able to take on epic bosses which give you all sorts of goodies when defeated. you can also buy gear and upgrade runes to alter your characters stats. there are also various mini games to be found all over the world, rewarding you with gold if you complete them. there is also a legacy system in place, which is quite neat. when you die instead of having to reload your game, you will play as one of your descendants, who will have unique characteristics he might be a dwarf, be colorblind, or have irratable boul syndrome etc. etc. . haven't seen anything like this in any other game, and honestly its quite cool. all in all a definite out of ! if you don't have it yet, what are you waiting for!? o

crusader kings ii is a combination real-time grand strategy game and dynastic rpg set in the middle ages. you play as a dynasty of rulers, nominally trying to take over territory and secure the stability of your realm and your line of succession. in practice you're trying to get up to whatever crazy medieval hijinks suits your fancy, often by doing your best impression of a disney villain. kidnapping, assassination, seduction, drunken carousing, the crusades, and dubious definitions of 'portugal' are all fair game in your quest for fun. the game's rpg elements are what set it apart from other strategy games and give it great replay value. when your ruler goes stark raving mad and begins appointing horses to important cabinet positions, or when you try to convince your heir to shape up and stop being a lazy heretic, it's all part of the fun.

every so often you're changed by a film, or a book, or a story told to you by someone who asked of you only that you sit and listen. and, one in a hundred, or one in a thousand, a game will move you in a way other than awe or laughter. i played to the moon. it poured sadness into me. and i played thomas was alone, and it filled me with fragile optimism and hope. and i played this game, and it filled me with bleakness. bleakness, not of an external existential sort, but an internal failure to recognise the value in ones self. i can't say i enjoyed this game. i did not laugh, i did not smile, i will never replay it. but it changed me, by connecting me with a human story that at the same time was impossibly alien and terrifyingly familiar.

all of the good design that went into monkey island , but more of it. this doesn't feel like a cash-in or a retread. it's a great game in it's own right and a fittingly absurd second act in the series. the special edition is as flawless as the remake fo the first game--excellent voice work, lovely art, hot-swapping between classic and special edition, and every detail clearly considered with care. i think this game is stronger than the first in just about every way. it's longer, it's more varied, the puzles are mostly well considered though there are a few ridiculously nonsensical stumpers, as seems to be inevitable in this genre , and behind the excellent humorous writing is a little more meat to each character's bones. it's a shame some of the other classics grim fandango? haven't received the same loving treatment. the quality of the remake is almost as impressive and enjoyable as the game itself. this is how you bring back a classic.

i lvoed fallout and played it a lot, including the dlc and spent many years playing through lots of quest mods settlers, etc to extend its lifespan. fallout had lost me in the first few hours - perhaps it'll grow on me, but i'm still playing and enjoying skyrim, which i find to be a much better game. fallout 's story so far has been awful - really really bad, and has left me with no choices for roleplaying. why would i go and explore when i'm searching for my son? the dialogue wheel, the addition of a voiced character and the film camera during speeches are further annoying touches that take me out of the experience. maybe i'll ammend this review once i've played more if i get the time to! , then i might change it. but for the first time since morrowind, i haven't enjoyed my time in a bethesda open-world game. very sad.

i actually didn't enjoy this second game as much as i had enjoyed the first. i like puzzling with boxes that have a finite set of surfaces, and not hunting through environments to find some forsaken area to click on. this game also focuses more on environments instead of boxes, and i just don't care much for the actual rooms. i was able to solve the first game without a single hint, but this game required me to use the hint system maybe - times, just because you get lost in a jungle of weird things that you don't know what to do. ..but it's a cheap game, even if i didn't buy it on sale. isn't much. the game ends with the developers specifically asking the player to write good steam reviews and promote the game in order to 'help them out', and that really rubs me the wrong way. ..so that settles it i'm not recommending this game. if you liked the first game, then let it end with that game.

overall, i liked the vibe of this game. however, the controls and the storyline made me give it a thumbs down. pros - pretty to look at - i love the back and forth action between the girl and the fox. it makes you think a little about who to use for what purpose. - the interviews about the inupiaq people were interesting, although the interviewees did not come off as very humble. cons - the controls are pretty annoying, most of the time. clunky. - it's pretty obvious what you need to do at any given time, until it's not..and you're stuck in one spot dying over and over again. - the storyline behind the game was pretty simplistic. simple conflict resolution, very minimal character development.

low playerbase you wait a long time to queue and imo very unbalanced mechanics. there's a great deal of luck that goes into each stage because you are forced to play four cards in a row blind, which means it's hard to react to an opponent's strategy. it's a little like throwing darts at one another in a dark room - it comes down to luck over strategy or skill. i do really like the sense of progression with the leveling system and achievements, and i wish other tcg would incorporate this. but i think faeria, duelyst amp might and magic have far better underlying mechanics. but maybe this will appeal to some people.

i really don't like the fact i need to dismantle stuff in order to move them. 'hey workers, dismantle this bed completely, take it to storage so you can bring it back, reassemble but this time facing north instead of east'. at scale it's disruptive and annoying because i need to remember everything i asked to dismantle so it can be reassembled in the place i had previously though of.

sequel to the original gay son simulator. why be bothered with troublesome gameplay, excitement, or action? instead, brush up on medieval inheritance laws and politics. meet new and interesting people, and then kill them. name your daughters after the pretty girls that shunned you in high school and show them who's boss. some time in your dungeon will cure them off their snide sneers, and then you can show them your impressive, prosperous empire. it's good to be king!

i really enjoy this game, but you have to deticate yourself to it. not in a significant way first the turtorial is really helpful and the community is as well. you will fail many times in this game everyone has, but when you understand the basics it can be really fun. here are somethings to remember when playing this game . be patient, the game takes a while to master and to learn .don't over play it in sitting otherwise it will be difficult to start playing again .be organized there are some pros and cons with this game that can be frustrating but enjoyable. pros good modding community detailed buildings and environment inteligent game that micromanages all the pesky things fun to play that gives you a sense of accomplishment and many more cons developer stopped working on this game the human ai isn't always inteligent takes a while to learn this is just my opinion of the game and if you are interested in getting it then watch gameplay from experts that explain the process of creating an excellent settlement

medieval warfare to me, it falls short of its downloadable content counterpart, but none the less it is a superb medieval warfare heh simulator. the combat and movement is clean and precise and it's got quality gameplay all around. and hell, i'd be lying if i said the taunts and battle cries dont crack me up some. if you're into swords and shields battling, this is the game for you. deadliest warrior what's better than slicing a pirate to shreds with a katana while your buddy is about to cave your skull in with a mace? stop talking, there isn't anything. this entirely worthy of stand-alone dlc provides hours upon hours of fun and competetive combat along with a variety of different warrior customizations and weapons. the maps are diverse and the scenery is beautiful, though i don't know how much time you'll have to spend looking at the trees as a viking is chopping your limbs off. overall, out of would buy again.

just the worst. unless you want another low graphics game, centered around dice rolling that rigged to you off. then don't bother. i don't even mind the low graphics, but it's very clear after at least tries to play the game, and attempts to get an endurance that doesn't roll below a every time. that it's not worth it. so glad i didn't spend a full dollar on this garbage. either fix your dice so monsters don't always roll and up, and i barely ever roll a and up ever. or don't bother making these games. it's obviously rigged, and i'm sick of seeing games like this come out of this company.

played the out of diablo . downloaded this because reviews said i would stop playing d for this game. logged in, attacked some crabs on the beach. most of the hits landed - seconds after i swung. logged out and launched diablo .

a text adventure for real puzzle-lovers. this is a game that's all about mastering something huge and complex. sophisticated automation of multi-step tasks helps you manage the complexity, but that just allows it to become even more complex. the alchemy here is a little reminiscent of the ritual magic in king's quest iii, but gives a stronger sense of being a system, with recipes that support substitutions. i originally played the ios version, but the steam version has the same content, with a somewhat improved ui. finally i can keep the alchemy journal open in a separate window while typing in commands!

the problem is 'free mode' which is advertised in a way to give the idea of a free to play model, i think it's deliberately made to be misleading to fool f p players. i can't support such behauvior and neither should any gamer. the game itself was entertaining, at least for the short term since i quit the game as soon as i decided the managers wasn't explicit about free mode. the playerbase on steam never experiences a sustainable increase, mostly because of the free mode in my opinion since people don't get to play the characters they like after a rotation or they don't even get to their potentially favourite characters from the start and leave the game frustrated. in my opinion, a game should be either free or not. when it forces people to buy the game, it's not a pleasant experience for most. verdict

boring, repetitive and easy. just racing against the clock. there is more than one opponent, but it does not make any sense, since colin mcrae is always the fastest opponent and it only matters whether you are in the st place or not. would be passable if it wasn't a time trial but rather a race with other components.

this game is a mild horror game with exploration at its core. it's a fun survival game that's not to hard to balance. food and water come often so it's not to easy to starve or get dehydrated. the story is pretty good as well! only issue i've had is once i got through the second temple i cannot progress any further. everytime i hit the loading screen the game freezes and loops the loading animation and song. not sure if this is a problem with the game itself or with my computer. i'll look into it more and update this review when i find the solution

this game is rubbish and a complete waste of my . i wish i have read the reviews and follow their advice, which is don't buy! the only game on my list that is worse than this is realms of arcania blade of destiny, which is a total con. you cannot save the game it only saves automatically whenever it wants , the combat system is bad, the interface is even worse, the graphics are rubbish, the voice acting is average and the story seems just ok - i wasn't going to waste more than the hrs i've already spent to find out if it was better than the other aspects of this game. the 'puzzles' are ludicrous, e.g. how do i open this door? oh there's a lever next to it! , the maps are small and linear. on top of that the game has crashed times in hrs for no apparent reason and the graphics movement are so bad that my eyes get tired after a few minutes of play time.. so save your money and buy something decent instead. needless to say that the . price tag is a bigger joke than the game itself.

i have been a long time fan of the assassin's creed games for a long time. i have played them all up to the most recent one due to hardware limitations. this one is by no means the best, in fact, it's the worst. i can't quite put my finger on why, but movement doesn't seem as natural as in the other games. combat is also much more difficult than in previous games, which can be looked at as a good thing or a bad thing. it defintely promotes stealth over open combat. you can also crouch in this game which is something that ac fans have been wanting for a while now. even though i like this game, and there is so much to do, i can't reccomend it because it didn't live up to the previous games.

bottom line if you're looking for another ftl, keep looking. i was a kickstarter backer and really wanted this game to be awesome, but it just isn't worth recommending. there are a lot of flaws in the gameplay, quests, story, visuals, music, interface, and pretty much every other category there are too many to list -- see here for an extremely thorough list. there was no point in me expounding when this guy already summed up everything i feel about this game. i would be happy to see this game receive patches that improve on these flaws and change my reviews to positive if they can address all the concerns out there. but there seem to be a rather large number of fundamental flaws, and i am not sure the devs can merely 'fix' them with patches here and there. i should add that i am not merely trying to compare this to ftl. i legitimately wanted to have fun with this for its own sake, and ftl merely serves as a convenient reference point, as according to steamspy, of convoy owners also own ftl.

dead space remains both my favourite horror game and third-person shooter. the combination of engineer tools for weapons, unique kill system cut off the limbs , and atmosphere made the game both pleasantly frightening and refreshing in challenge. like any good horror game on the highest difficulty, you always feel like you're at a disadvantage, but the unfortunate catch is that once you've played through the game a couple times you begin to remember where the enemies spawn making even the higher difficulties less life threatening. i highly recommend this game to any fans of games like resident evil and anyone who wants a break from the monotonous headshot competition that other shooters often fall victim to.

don't buy this! minutes in and i'm already stuck and definetely not going to start over if there is another place i can get stuck again. stop taking peoples money if you don't even bother fixing issues the game has! spoiler in my case, i was in a room where you escaped from the first vampire bat you meet on the second floor. i first got stuck in the fireplace view after i picked up a nail and didn't see the poker you were suppose to pickup too, so i quit the game then went back and now i can't pick up that poker in the fireplace or the nail since it's already in my inventory even though you can still see it in the fireplace.

i'm playing this on a much lower spec gpu than most of the negative reviewers in fact it doesn't even meet the minimum requirements so settings are quite low but still at p and i'm finding it quite playable.. at first the initialize screen confused me hold e to get past in case you are wondering but once i was in i was blown away, it's such an odd place this world of mine.. minus temps in the day and colder at night, i am quite engrossed already in resource gathering and flora fauna discovery and i've only been at it an hour. i could see me easily losing a day on this and it to only feel like a few hours. not sure how i'll feel after hours of gameplay but inital impressions are good and if there are discoveries to be made on other worlds i'm all for a bit of planet-hopping fun!

awesome game,maybe old-fashion but it is surely addictive!! once you start,you can not stop playing! i recommend you give it a try,it isnt gonna hurt. it takes minutes to download and its free! a big bonus is the fun,and yet level up feeling. as you collect crates for say,collect crates in life you unlock a new level to play on! now trust me,it may sound easy but it sure as hell isn't!

old school.. somewhat revitalised far from the classic it's hailed as, though it still looks good and holds up decently after all these years, sparingly providing moments of mild fun. the story is unengaging and it's pretty much a mindless corridor shooter through samey environments, littered with incredible annoyances such as the game's dated insistence on cheap-shotting you by spawning enemies behind you and the massive oversight that is the lack of flashlight weapon attachments.

one to play with friends. you can solo this game but it's much more fun and the combat more interesting with others. the world is beautiful, the story and lore surprisingly deep and the music is great d this one is worthy.

put simply the best story driven game i have ever seen, this game has a better made story than some best selling books in my opinion. to the moon is a beautifully written game that brings tears to my eyes one minute, creeps me out the next and after it's done all that it makes me laugh like an idiot, a big factor of this is the music. the mainly acoustic piano soundtrack is amazingly written to fit each situation, so well in fact it made me actually look up the sheet music, print it out and start learning the pieces. to the moon is full of story and tons of humour that can make you laugh out loud, it deserves every single good recommendation it gets. if you love a good book pick this game up and play it, you won't be disappointed.

fascinating modern spin on a cybperunk story that asks the question, what if we had the technology to alter peoples memories? many interesting ideas and quesitons are floated, set in an odd pastiche of future paris and zombie slums. sadly, the actual gameplay is extremely linear and mainly consists of linear tomb raider style climbign sequences but not as well executed and beat em up fights that get old quick. that said, the game features sequences of gameplay where you get to 'remix' someones memories..to change their memories of their own pasts, and thus their identies in the present. they are all very cool, and you probably have not played something like that before. i would have prefered this as an adventure game, without the combat or endless wall climbing. still though, worth a playthrough if you have a couple of long evenings to spend.

this was a fun game to play when i was in university. i've since moved on to battlefield and , and i can say, without any reservation, that this was a fun game. there's a big learning curve for newcomers, but the reward is hours and hours of entertainment and interactions with your friends and opponents.

if you are looking for a top down shooter to play with some friends. don't buy this. the camera feels waaay to limited in this. buy running with rifles instead also no filthy dlc which i highly recommend to play with mates and have a top down shooter itch.

i'll assume you've played some type of magic before in the past and save us both the detailed review of how to play. this version is free-to-play, which in my opinion, makes it better than the previous duels games. you need to play 'skill quests' which are mostly short tutorials for enough gold to open some packs. it's a bit of a waste of time for veterans of the game but i can be useful as a refresher. i don't think they will have any upkeep cards in this version. and yes, planeswalkers are in. most of the story mode missions are terrible. they are either way too easy or pit your unfocused premade vs a lethal boss with life jace boss . finally, there have been a huge amount of problems since launch with servers being down, people getting thousands of free gold coins, and i personally have had boosters worth of cards totally removed from my collection upon relaunching the game. right now i can't say i recommend this game, but once stability issues are resolved it will slide just barely into recommend. go play hearthstone right now instead for a reliable ccg.

i finished the game. at the beginning i was dissapointed due to the lack of vito scaletta. as the game progressed, i became increasingly interested in the story, the setting, and how the game kept its mode. there were many repetitive phases in the game yet the story and the soundtrack full of good classics were enchanting and wonderful. on hard mode, the game is truly challenging. i have no regrets of playing this game, i really liked it.

tough game but a lot of fun to play co-op. the game consists of shooting amp running from zombies, looting vacant buildings, and visiting shops. shop prices vary, so you never know if the next one will have a good deal. ammo is always scarce so i was forced to buy up as much as possible early on. occasionally a vacant building will have an alarm which summons a horde of zombies, it's a quick way to end your game accidentally unless you're prepared. i would pay full price for this, but it's always best to wait for a sale.

i really like this game. it has most everything i like in a turn based strategy game. for the price it is well worth it. the graphics engine in the game kind of sucks in that it is slow at times but do you really play strategy games for fluid graphics? most of the bad reviews of this game site it is buggy. i was at launch and while in beta but i have played hours and never encountered one bug or crash. for lt its worth it. i haven't even unlocked the nd level or rd level units.. but i love the diversity of play with ranged mele fast slow.. magic physical units. the enemies are interesting. the build paths for your stronghold are a bit confusing but using advanced mode for that helps. all in all i played this game almost hours straight with work breaks and time to sleep and i really like it.

it was great mistake that i thought this was going to be another fantastic fps game. it was lack of information. i should've doubted more before buying. i thought every fps games are thrilling back then. never thought there were fps games like these. inefficient, unnecessarily realistic, military simulation game which is boring, tiring, and long. you have npcs helping you so single player mode feels like co-op a little. aiming is easy. - there is no clue in mapping. - once you miss some part of dialogue some clues are gone forver. you have to look it up on the internet. - in the map the arrow that represents you isn't looking where you're actually looking so you have to press m unnecessarily lot. - in some missions you don't know which one is side quests or main quests. - you die in one or three shots.

a loving rebuild of the original. smoother performance overall. the formula remains mostly the same except there's a ton of items to discover. so much so that you'll need to put in a significant amount of hours to acquaint yourself with them all. this will be overwhelming for new players, but add replayability for veterans. both the afterbirth expansion and a new incoming official expansion will only add to that effect. it's hard to recommend this or the original for new players in . options for this style of game abound and have taken the torch. compared to other titles, combat here, while not easy, plays itself. you may or may not luck out with item drops that are overpowered or underpowered. the setting and storyline are a despondent mix of religion, death, and potty humor that only detracts from the tight gameplay, and again others have done a much better job.

monkey island mi is a unique blend of bizarro characters, whacky plots amp even stranger puzzles! the most entertaining aspect of monkey island though is the humor used throughout in the dialog, situations amp actions you perform. it's rare to have humor used so well in a game. with your want-to-be pirate , 'hero', ahem , guybrush threepwood there are plenty of hair-pulling challenges amp interesting locations to explore. there is even swashbuckling sword play, although in a much more creatively different way than you would ever expect! mind you, that will happen a lot in mi, where the most creative .. strange .. crazy step is often the next step, not the logical one you think. the fresh coat of paint in the special edition with its d-ish cartoon look enhances the setting well, although you can also switch to the classic graphics at any time too! voice acting is excellent taking full advantage of the great dialog. always enjoyable taking a pirate holiday back to mi! yarr! timeless point 'n' click adventure! one of the best! if you enjoyed reading this review, please follow true blue reviews for more recommendations!

it is rare when i am stunned by a game. often games can be entertaining, visually stunning or encompase complex story arcs, but rarely do they acheive all three. remember me is a beautiful game. i lost count how many times i just sat back and looked at the environment, often getting attacked in the process. the combat is not complex once you get used to it and by the end you flow around your enermy, dancing between blows like a ballet of violance. the story is imaginative, thoughtful and well written, with strong voice acting and presence. in the end you drift past the combat, knowing that your enermy will meet their poetic demise, because all you desire is to understand the next glimpse of your fractured memory. this game is a cross between deus ex, mirrors edge and a film i used to love called renaissance staring daniel craig . if i were to critic this game, and i am loathed to do so, it is a little short and i completed it in about hours.

the game is simply beautiful. it was gifted to me by a friend under a premise of not knowing anything about the game but to simply download it and play it. i thoroughly enjoyed the peacful experience that the game brings. it has great flow, great controlls, beautiful soundtrack and is just a joy to play. would recommend to everyone.

road to ballhalla is at its core a simple roll-the-ball-into-the-hole-at-the-end-of-the-level-game. this gameplay is however embedded into a number of challenging levels with some really nice features rhythm based levels that make you move to the beat loved that despite failing hard . many levels introduce new gameplay mechanics so there is always something new. also, a nice learning curve through the whole game. different puzzles make intelligent use of the gameplay mechanics. level editor for endless level building! style your ball! it is strangely rewarding to unlock a new style. the road to ballhalla is not easy but no one said that it would be. i would recommend this game to any fan of the genre. also if you have one, play it with a controller.

i decided to feed and make friends with some of the wildlife on the planets, now they follow me everywhere i love the music, it's so relaxing and fit's the game perfectly, i wish my ship inventory from the start was bigger, i like collecting stuff also regarding the technical issues people have been having like the fps stutter, it's noticable but not game breaking and only for less than a second, i've also had no crash to desktops so i suppose i've been lucky. i'll be honest the game isn't perfect and the price is too high thanks sony but for what a ten man team has achieved with this game it's pretty incredible. edit after playing for a few hours i have no experienced two crashes, one whilst mining and one in space travel.

the game is definitely a mind bender. while the controls are simple, the world a side scrolling d world, this is far from a boring game. the story, the art style, the bakgrounds, everything makes you think and wonder what is going on. even some of the later game mechanics make you ponder what the world is. for those of you that have not played it, i suggest giving it a try. it requires critical thinking and problem solving, but not in the ways one might think. every situation has a solution, whether easy to see or not. great game by my standards, and interestingly enough, this game actually frustrated me at some points when i couldn't solve the problems outright, which is what i tend to do in most games. that being said, i highly recommend this game.

i'll recommend this game because i love it, but i understand it's not for everyone. this game initially takes several hours of learning before it's ready to play, and several days further to really master. if you've no patience for these things and just want some plug-and-play fun, this game is probably not for you. this game is technically an mmo, so even if you play in 'solo' it's still balanced like an mmo. that means that you'll be grinding to get the best equipment and ships. i think the variety in money-making activities is large enough to make it remain interesting for a long time. this game is still being updated and is far from done, but i think this is already an amazing game.

this flight sim when i first got was fairly impressive but it lacks clear menu's as it is not easy to find your way around. like many flight simulators you have to invest in aircraft and other addons for the full experience especially airliners. the defualt boeing has really poor cockpit quality and takes away from the experience, so i got a jardesign a and a which is costly. however it is well worth it. the atc is fairly buggy and i never use it but there are great plugins like x-life. the scenery and night lightening is generally outstanding and again can be made better with mods. i have played on a laptop and it was good but fps was an issue. you need quite a powerful pc. overall its a great sim especially if you have a few bob to spend don't be expecting hundreds of planes as generally nearly every flight sim is costly iff you want a great experience. it is definalty my favourite flight sim.

buy it on sale if it's under .. as so many others have said, i like x type games and i loved alpha centauri. i still play ac every so often. this game has some interesting ideas, some fun units and some nice artwork. what kills it for me and why i had to down vote the game is the lack of replayability. lt spoilers ahead gt after the first couple of games, you know basically how the eras are going to go. you know that night will fall, you know that an alien menace will come from gates that must be closed and what kills it is that you know when and how these things will happen. these aren't cool random events, they happen every time. so all you're really doing is playing the exact same set of 'random' events again and again. perhaps wwii simulation players who enjoy re-playing battles over and over using slightly different tactics or from different angles would be more appreciative of this title. for x players or at least for me it's too static.

general overview i picked up up during a steam winter sale when i had plenty of time on my hands. i sunk hours into the regular unmodded version then picked up a few mods and never looked back. i can easily see each mod taking hours and that's just single player for one playthrough. this game is fantastic in its strategy when modded. great if you enjoy being able to both fight in large battles and manage a kingdom. pros tons of mods for everything you can think of unlimited replayability multiplayer fairly active depending on mod low requirements medieval setting is generally adhered to cons native unmodded has a few bugs and balance issues can become repetitive quickly lacks some strategy elements if unmodded tl dr great game with tons of content to explore already use mods to enhance it even further and you'll have tons more hours to play. if you enjoy medieval fighting and strategy, this is for you.

frustrating obstacles past hazard where the game goes too fast and you cannot pass them no matter how hard you try ex wall slide log . the problem isn't the fact that it goes fast i like fast games , the problem is that it isn't involving skill, it's involving impossibility. you have to jump to pass the wall, and if you jump, you stub yourself into the logs behind, you can't reach the ground to slide under it, so the level can't be completed unless you are lucky with the layout. and the game hasn't much to offer, it's just always the same scenery, and an horrible uninspired grind it takes hours in order to be able to buy an uninspired upgrade there are so many better endless runners, free and paying, i can't find the appeal of this one.

first of all.. not nearly as scary as outlast. damn you outlast for spoling me with fear!! so if you are looking for something like that.. then no. that being said, the game itself is quite lovely looking. game play is very straighforward..you can't really go anywhere wrong. it kind of plays itself. it's spooky, but not crippling scary. and as usual, no weapons in these horror games. i played with keyboard and mouse. finished in less than hrs without achievements.. but only because i like to open cabinets. graphics well done! bugs actually didn't find anything in my travels. motionsickness oddly i didn't feel sick playing. odd, considering how many hallways there are. the fov is pretty spot on. story is ok. unravels itself as you play. would i recommend this game? yes! however.. do not expect to have a game experience like amnesia or outlast where you have to hide in shadows and sneak around. there are some jump scares, tho. this game is creepy spooky, but for me it wasn't overly scary. bottom line play it for the experience, but not for scares.

i've played through every single heroes of might and magic game as they were released, and this is definitely my favorite one post-homm iii. the improved gameplay and interface over v, the more cohesive castles, and series-unique take on magic make it very engaging. the campaign is much better than iv or v as well. but like everyone else has mentioned, this game is absolutely crippled by always-online drm, having to log into install uplay, and weird overpowered unlocks tied to an achievement point system cash shop. you will get booted from your game arbitrarily. it will happen, and more than once. until this game is disconnected from all the ubisoft garbage, i can't recommend this game at all.

simply beautiful. as another reviewer states not a game, but an experience. a vignette. you visit a series of locations in a valley on the cusp of destruction and learn the history of the civilisation that flourished there over thousands of years. the artwork, score and text combine to build a magnificently melancholy atmosphere as you explore, leading to the game's satisfying culmination. recommended if it sounds like your cup of tea.

this is my new favorite application and my best purchase on steam ever. not only does it enable full control of your pc with a controller, it bridges the gap between games with partial controller support and full controller support. take project cars for example. you'd obviously want a wheel or a controller to play a racing game, however in order to exit the game you need to drag the mouse into the top right corner. so what do you do? you hold the back button and hit start and all of a sudden you are navigating a mouse with your controller using the 'a' button as the left mouse click. absolutely essential buy for controller users, big picture users and people who use controllers to play on laptops when space is limited. for the price this is a must buy. out of

returning to it's roots, all-be-it in a simplified manner, might and magic x - legacy is a reboot in the right direction despite the stumbles. a nice new art direction favouring the look of the previous titles , it's nonetheless dragged down by poor pc optimisation and frequent fps drops. nothing game breaking but battle-music looping bugs does tarnish an otherwise thoroughly enjoyable experience. the game feels less complex than previous iterations, and this isn't such a bad thing as you have a clear idea what skills to maximise as you level up. what does it do flawlessly? hooking the player in.. i'm not sure why but after they optimised the tile-walking from the open beta i find myself encouraged to search the next dungeon, forest, cave, or castle whatever it might be. i had my house-mate sit down next to me and watch for hours as we quested, he enjoyed watching the adventuring and even the turn-based battles as i adjusted my tactics to suit the circumstances. good game in my opinion, i think this is a step in the right direction and hope to see a sequel.

for anyone with good reflexes and a taste for ultra-violence, good music, and retro graphics. read no further - go buy the game. don't even wait for a sale. if you have slow reflexes, or bad coordination however or if you simply dislike difficult games - this game is really not for you. in my own case despite having terrible coordination over all, i managed to grind my way to level before giving up. this is not the games fault, but merely a lack of the required ability to finish it. the game has thousands of reviews into the overwhelmingly positive category - so i think it's safe to add a thumbs down for casuals and the slower reflexed among us to be wary about spending your money. i would recommend checking out a gameplay video or trying it on someone's family account before buying it yourself. the difficulty is pretty steady from level on so you can get a good taste for it pretty quickly.

played it on gamecube. played it on wii. played it on pc. this game changed resident evil and even if you don't like the new ones, this is just amazing. like in other games the basic gameplay stays the same but the environment and enemies vary in a nice and exciting way. dependent on the difficulty you choose, the game achievs the true meaning of survival horror. you don't your pants but you may run like 'oh my god! oh my god! oh my god!'. sometimes your companion can be annoying but most of the time he she moves smarter than companions in other games. the checkpoints are kindly placed, so you can try to start the game on normal mode, even if you don't feel brave enough. there isn't a huge selection of weapons but later in the game you can choose between different pistols and rifles, which is a perfect amount for me. all in all this game is pure fun. there are no gamebreaking bugs i didn't experienced any bugs at all and the gameplay is fluent no long loading screens, boring things et cetera . i recommend to play this game with a controller.

this game is stupid, it tries to pass off ridiculously scripted levels as challenge when really it's just rote memorization and stupid timing. the controls stink, it's impossible to feather a jump. you either don't move forward at all during a jump or you jump full lenght, no half jumps. it's just frustratingly stupid in the end, no point in playing it. it could be a great game if levels and enemies were more random, there were difficulty settings, the jumping controls were better and there was more loot or skills to customize your experience. not every game has to be an rpg, but this one is like a poor version off an arcade game.

after the first or minutes, i immediatly was set in an immersive world full of characters on a large plane. i enjoyed exploring the crew and was eager to do things. the combat in this game is mediocre but functional, regardless though it hardly matters since it is such a small portion of the game. spoilers ahead, but they are required to understand why i am thumbing this down. i did not mind at all the idea of being an interdimensional traveller who is apparently prophesized to kill a boatload of people. however, the last minutes or so was spent in some kind of.. i haven't the slightest clue. just as i was about to close the game and go to bed, i met john and worked out his predicament. imagine my dissapointment when it rolls credits. i am not kidding. in fact, the game tells me to specifically break the th wall in the sequel, assuming it comes out. so let's review. a completly immersion breaking ending, asking me to break the th wall, hours of total gameplay, and we have consortium.

this game is plagued with bugs i'll just list one every other hole i'm digging i can't set up ladders in. which means my dwarf at the bottom of the pit will die as he cannot get out of it unless i teleport him back up manually and the hole becomes unusable. in a game where the main goal is to dig down this pretty much ruins everything. the prospect of the game was nice, the specialization of the dwarfs, the leveling up and researching are nice. but the execution is bad. you get lost so easily with the huge amount of stories you build on, you lose dwarfs way too quickly and too often and digging is a pain. it also drags on forever, as your workers stop to sleep and eat so often. much of the pain could be spared by having the digger build ladders automatically but what to expect from a company that offers you decorative item dlcs in such singleplayer game? this thing is unpolished - i would like to see the good in it but it keeps me off. do not buy!

well i have to say, while hg is a well made game, it simply lacks the same level of team work and intensity of day of infamy. hg has a lot of potential to be made into the free to play ww game and so far it does not feel like a battle simulation but a oversized counter strike. what do i meant by that ? . by allowing soldiers to deploy all over the map instead of in waves, hg lacks the motivation to play as a team and does not feel like an intense military game. in day of infamy soldiers dies like flies but it is a lot of fun. . games like day of infamy has officers, who has to work with the radio soldier to call in orders or arty, it again encourages team play while make the game more realistic. . for a game that should be free, paying players are overpoweredl. it would be nice to at least give the free players better anti tank weapons. . it is stupid to give soldiers hp points, it makes again the paying players more advantaged given their automatic weapons.

where to even start! the voice acting is incredible, not many people ever give actors much credit in reviews if any. graphically the game is a step up, next gen games are looking very vivid, and running very smooth. all of the areas have so much to look at, tons of ground clutter, and so many awesome secrets to explore at the same time. the crafting system, and most other elemets stayed the same from the game. which is totally fine, because it worked very well. i'm only a few hours into the game and i'm totally in love with everything about it. the appealing female has nothing to do with it . it's on sale right now, so if you don't have this game in your library it needs to be put into it. exploration, explosions, and ancient ruins! honestly i don't see this formula getting old at any point, seeing as i'm going to school for archaeology anthropology. not that it's going to be anywhere near this exciting, but it sure gets the blood flowing! game gets a out of from me!

so, my friend got this game for free from the dev for me for whatever reason , and.. well, i could talk about the fact that it looks and plays like it was just created in an hour, but i've got something different. when i tried playing this the first time, i had to close the game shortly afterwards iirc, there was something wrong with it's launch . after this, i could not launch the game because it's .exe file was missing. even after verifying the files several times, the .exe just kept mysteriously vanishing. after asking the dev why i couldn't get the .exe to stay, he suggested i re-install the game which worked , and i had the wonderful pleasure of playing such a wonderfully broken game note i played before the patch was launched but i can't because the .exe is missing again anyways , so it might be better in some slight way? . but this was back on july th, so why am i writing a review now? because i found all of the .exe's today. in the avast virus chest . it made my day, but i still wouldn't recommend the game.

timeshift is a solid game, if not a bit short. being able to control time to some extent is awesome, slowing time down to make it easier to kill enemies, stopping time to pass a hazard of some sort or even rewind ot to get access to a passage that was destroyed only moments ago, is simply awesome. the enemies even acknowledge it, when you stop time, move to a different location and the enemies then see you there, saying something like 'he can warp' and be totally surprised, makes you feel awesome and powerful. as i said, the game is pretty short, you see the ending ina good day of playing it, but at least the developers did a good job utilising the time-warping mechanics. the story ends with a kind of cliffhanger, we are oblivious to the fate of our character, so a sequel might be possible and i would wish for one.

a collection of retro style games made in modern tijmes. if you played the original nintendo system and are looking for a fun little throwback then this game is well worth it. shuten is probably the best in the lot, being a bullet hell shooter with fun, cool bosses. the puzzles in end of line are unique enough to warrant their own game with better graphics. i was surprised to see such good quality puzzles in this. clew land is where you play a basic animal thing that gruadually evolves into different forms through eating and exploring. the others are decent enough. if graphics effect your enjoyment out of gaming and you never played the original nintendo then you will definitely be dissapointed. it is what it is, a retro game crunch.
